Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique”
Reviews.Author: DanicoBergbaum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights around Easter when the city was very busy. The staff was always accommodating and willing to assist with our many questions. When we blew our plug adapter they had spares on hand so we could continue taking a million pictures. They provided champagne and strawberries on arrival since it was our honeymoon. They made reservations for us for dinner. I thought breakfast was fantastic with a variety of meat, cheeses and pastries (a little something for everyone). The common spaces were beautiful. We stayed in the Pompeiana (room 813) which was a standard room. We took a lot of care to pick out this room because it had a huge and amazing bathtub in the photos. Did not disappoint. A beautiful room with a view out onto the garden and the bathtub was amazing after a long day of walking around. Words to the wise that I do not consider negatives - Prepare to walk. The Aventine is not in the middle of everything. But it is very doable. Also, the metro is very usable. Lastly, the beds are a bit harder than what most Americans are used to. But this is not a flaw of the hotel but rather a difference in culture that I point out only so that people are not surprised and think it is something particular to this hotel. Our stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Calm, beautiful, elegant hotel on the Aventine hill”
Reviews.Author: therealpecus
Reviews.Content: The Sant'Anselmo hotel on the Aventine Hill is an excellent hotel hosted in a historical building. Renovated in style, akin to boutique hotels, it offers a blend of classic and modern (beautiful and elegant) furniture and decorations, with every room differently styled. The service is excellent (for instance, at check-in you are greeted with a welcome drink), and cleanliness superb. Morning breakfast is rich: I only wished I didn't find three days of bad weather that prevented us from enjoying it outside (there are patios in the back and in the front of the hotel). The hotel is part of a group of three, all located nearby, and a restaurant has been opened recently (though being just a few minutes of walk from Testaccio, we didn't try it). Keep in mind the being above a hill, if you have to reach it on foot it's a 5/10 minutes walk uphill (from the nearest bus stop). The Aventine is a residential area with beautiful centuries-old buildings, trees and parks. It's calm, quite and perfect for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “On the Aventine Hill”
Reviews.Author: schippk
Reviews.Content: There are oranges outside my window. And yellows and golds. And cypresses and date palms. Even the deepest nine-hour jet lag yields to the tinkling sounds of tiny birds and a shaft of spring sunlight falling across open luggage and scattered clothes. Waking up after a night's journey halfway around the world can be disorienting. But to open your eyes in a room in the Hotel San Anselmo is to know you're in Rome. Near the crest of the Aventine Hill, the San Anselmo is set in a peaceful neighborhood of quiet palazzos, elegant apartments and ancient churches. Down the street are parks with sweeping views of the Eternal City's domes, spires and jagged ruins. The hotel's decor is a playful modern nod to the city's Baroque heritage, with striped canopies over the windows and inlaid marble bathroom floors. A blast from the dual-head shower followed by a warm towel from the heated racks is steadying enough for a trip down to the airy, orchid-filled breakfast room for the buffet of hot and cold items, included in the hotel's rates. The San Anselmo often hosts managers and consultants with business in the international agencies headquartered in Rome. The morning tables are occupied by serious-looking professionals logged in to the hotel's complimentary wi-fi, flicking intently away at smartphone screens. There is no restaurant, but the barman is always happy to whip up a toasted panino and pour a glass of prosecco for you to enjoy in an overstuffed chair in the lounge. Or if you'd rather sit on the terrace with a cappucino while reading La Repubblica under the grapevines, you have only to ask. Service at the San Anselmo is flawless. The staff are pleasant and efficient and graciously see to it that guests' needs are met. From a 3:00 AM wake-up to numerous phone calls and considerable time wrangling with an airline when I mistakenly thought I had left a pair of glasses on the plane, nothing was ever a problem. And who needs a hotel restaurant when you are a few blocks' walk down a curving cobblestoned street from some of Rome's best dining? At the foot of the Aventine Hill, across the jumbled traffic of the Via Marmorata, lies the Testaccio neighborhood. Historically the site of the city's butchers, it's still the place to go to sample Rome's traditional snout-to-tail cuisine. Testaccio is also home to the famous Volpetti deli, a jewelry shop of the finest delicacies the Italian peninsula can provide, from meats and cheeses to pastas, wines, and a densely sweet, espresso-colored balsamic vinegar the clerks will insist you taste. Next to the deli is Volpetti Piu, a tavola calda where servers dish up ample helpings of roast chicken, octopus salad, stuffed zuccini blossoms and rice balls for patrons in a plain, fluorescent-lit space. Tourists and Roman families crowd the tables, sipping hearty house wine and discussing the day's events between forkfuls of steaming fresh lasagne and stuffed tomatoes. The Aventine Hill is only a Metro stop or two from Rome's most iconic tourist sights. But after a day of noise, crowds, fake gladiators outside the Colosseum, spilled gelato and cultural overload, there's no more peaceful place to retire. Climb wearily out of the Piramide metro stop. Walk past the ancient Aurelian Walls and the pyramid-shaped tomb of imperial official Caius Cestus (like you, a tourist, who had his burial place modeled on those of the Pharaohs after a visit to Egypt). Head up the cobbled street, past the giggling schoolchildren and the yellow mimosa branches trailing over the stone walls. Wander on to the crest of the hill, past the discreet polished brass placard marking the Egyptian Embassy to the Holy See. Across the street is a plain wall, with a few tourists standing around, their black-leather-jacket-clad taxi drivers chatting near their idling vehicles waiting a few yards down the street. Approach the ancient door to see what the other visitors are bending down to view. The door, perpetually locked, has a keyhole that perfectly frames a view of Saint Peter's dome hovering serenely over the gardens of the Knights of Malta. The other tourists get back into their taxis, leaving the neighborhood to silence and the singing birds. But you'll be lucky enough to walk a block back to the San Anselmo.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Natalie B
Reviews.Content: San Anselmo is one of a group of three hotels in a quiet residential area of Rome on Aventino hill. We have stayed in the other two, which are excellent, but this is by far the best. Our room was to die for, a four poster bed and spacious bathroom. The beauty of this hotel is outstanding. Beautifully furnished guest lounge rooms to relax in, lavish breakfast room and the outdoor areas are so charming and peaceful. After a busy day walking around Rome this is the place to come home to. Whilst the hotel is just a short distance from the centre of Rome (buses and the metro nearby) the location is perfect, quiet and with beautiful buildings all around. The hotel staff cannot be faulted, so helpful with restaurants recommendations, sightseeing, and car to airport. The only place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amaizing location”
Reviews.Author: ziocut
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel on top of Aventino hill. I strongly reccomend it for tourists willing to walk around Rome. Breakfast in the garden is worth the choice of this hotel. Ask for top floor rooms where the viene is breathtaking. Close to the famous door with the St. Peter view have also a walk to the orango tree garden with a marvellous view. For traditional dining go to Testaccio.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious Rome.....amazing villa ..happy visitors from Asia”
Reviews.Author: JARUmilan
Reviews.Content: The feel and experience that we are looking for in Italy with style. Not a big hotel but this is what we wanted - privacy! The interiors are truly boutique and each rooms have character. staff are very courteous and very friendly we feel at home! I have lots of friends who booked in some other hotel in the center and commented on the size and cleanliness - obviously we did not experience it in S.anselmo. Experience living in a stylish Italian villa. We will surely go back.....oh forgot to mention it is near the Parco dei Arranci , with a 3 min walk get a picturesque view of the Tiber river and the imposing Saint Peter Basilica. Albert Uy- Manila, Philippines

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: baggagecarrier
Reviews.Content: The hotel, where I have stayed several times before, is one of three located on the lovely and peaceful Aventino hill. The other two hotels, the Villa San Pio and Aventino, are three star and very pleasant but the San Anselmo is the queen of the three, 4 star and well worth it. The decor is a combination of baroque and ultra modern - photogenic for sure. The mangement is exceptionally simpatico to the extent that when I told them that we had to check out at 4 A.M. to get to the airport they offered to pack us a breakfast. We splurged on a room with a huge terrace - it was a worth every euro. We entertained guests with drinks and snacks in their main reception room which also has a small outdoor area. The walled entrance area is furnished with comfortable seating and the back of the building has a beautiful garden where breakfast is served in warm weather. I have recommended this hotel to many friends and they have all loved it. The hotel does not have a restaurant but there are many good spots within easy walking distance and if you don't want to eat out they'll make you a good panini, or even better you can get something spectacular from the Volpetti Deli just down the hill. The Avenine Hill has a number of interesting ancient churches, the famous orange garden with it's view of St Peters and the keyhole in the doorway entrance to the Knights of Malta where the same sight is availabe in miniature.

Reviews.Title: “A quality bijou hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barry W
Reviews.Content: We could find nothing to fault at hotel San Anselmo. All that we expected and more was provided by the hotel which was recommended by an English friend who has lived in Italy for over 20 years and travels extensively in Europe. The staff were friendly, courteous and knowledgeable, providing us with advise on restaurants and travel in Rome. Beautiful rooms excellent breakfasts and wonderfully peaceful after the tourist areas. All in all a great place to stay at a sensible price.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a peaceful setting”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan T
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel whilst reviewing an old copy of the Sunday Times travel supplement, which identified it as one of 50 Top Hotels to stay in Europe. The setting was particularly tranquil, situated as it is in the Aventine area of the city, and offered a pleasant alternative if you wanted to stay away from the really touristy areas - only around 10-15 minute walk along the river from the main attractions. The room was very comfortable and well finished, and the staff friendly. The dining area was a very ornate affair offering a substantial choice of options for breakfast. If I was to visit Rome again, I would definitely consider this as my top choice of hotel. First Class!

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: Marbermom
Reviews.Content: My daughter was in boarding school nearby, so we chose the hotel initially based on location, but returned for each visit because we just love the hotel. Beautiful, unique rooms, lovely breakfast, peaceful neighborhood. We are walkers, so the distance to the touristy areas didn't bother us, and on rainy days taxis or the bus was very easy. The staff are wonderful....and here is a story to prove it. I ate dinner at one of the sister hotels and when I returned to the San Anselmo, I realized I had lost about 200 Euro cash. The San Anselmo called back to the restaurant, but they did not find my cash. I had given up on finding it as it was late at night...but then I got a call from the front desk....the head waiter had been walking between the hotels and found my cash scattered all along the sidewalk! He had gathered it up and returned it - this was a lot of money and there was no way anyone would have known if he had just pocketed it! This sort of service and honesty was truly heartening.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: triplover25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 days after Christmas. Every part about our stay was fantastic. The hotel itself it beautiful, the room we had was incredible and the staff are friendly and very accommodating. The breakfast in the morning is in a beautiful room with lots of light and the selection of food is vast. Very good quality. Included with the room and well worth it. The lounge area is a great place to have a drink and recharge before heading out for dinner. The location is a little off the beaten path but it is not a very long walk to get to the Circo Massimo metro and actually it is sort of nice being in a more residential neighbourhood where it is quiet. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone going to Rome and we will certainly be back. Thank you for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Rome if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: L S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for two nights and were very happy with rooms, service and location of this place. If you don't have a car it's not in the most touristy area of the city and not easy to walk to those areas but if you do have a car, I highly recommend you to stay ay this hotel. Its in a very charming neighbourhood which is very pretty and quiet. It's really easy to park your car in front or at the allocated car park of the hotel. Breakfast is pretty good and goes until 11 pm, service very good and staff is friendly but more so very kind and respectful. Rooms are spacious, well decorated and also very airy with high ceilings and big windows with most charming views. Stay there, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maralyn C
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this delightful hotel in a very quiet and beautiful location. We had a room with a balcony which was lovely to sit and watch the locals passing by. The room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable and quite spacious. The staff were very helpful with enquiries and directions and one evening we had dinner at a restaurant just a short walk which was connected to the hotel. The breakfast was inviting and in a lovely setting. I would certainly recommend this hotel as a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Anselmo, Rome”
Reviews.Author: bobandjanet44
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 4-night stay here in early October, 2011. Hotel is one of 3 properties closely located on the Aventine Hill---great location. One of the sister hotels has a fine dinner restaurant. Extended continental breakfasts here were very adequate. Rooms finely appointed and staff was continually attentive and helpful. Location is a very quiet well-to-do area (several consulates within a block), yet a short walk down the hill to a main street with multiple good restaurant choices and gelato. That main street has several bus lines including #23 that goes right to the Vatican. Location is an easy one-mile walk (or two Metro stops) to the Colosseum and Roman Forum. Great views of the Tiber and the Vatican from the end of the street. Also, the "keyhole", is at the street's end---read about this before the trip---where you can view St. Peter's Basilica through this hole in what is the property of the displaced Knights of Malta. Popular attraction as there were always a dozen or so people waiting their turn to look. Hotel offers deals on their website, so was actually very reasonable. Tea and snacks offered every day at 4 PM. Outside eating area in back also--some tables under cover--for breakfast, 4 PM drinks, or in the evening. Would definitely stay here again. Bob and Janet

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cagsAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I searched hard to find a hotel that just outside of the restricted area for cars. I found this lovely hotel, and it could not have been more perfect. A short walk from Circus Maximus, they had offsite parking that was very convenient. Rooms could not have been prettier. Garden in the rear for breakfast. The only warning is that it is difficult to fine. Website for hotel is not very good on this point. Its in a residential area, and many of the roads are one way, which means you see it, but can't get to it. Do a bit more homework than I did, and you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheryl K
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful and location was great. The restaurant at the sister hotel, San Pio was excellent and the atmosphere was beautifu. The best food that we had in Rome. Hotel staff were very helpful especially Alessandro and Vincenzo, at the front desk. The bar staff were great as well and made wonderful martinis. Our room was beautiful & we had a great balcony overlooking the street. Great for morning coffee & breakfast which was delivered, upon request, to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a local”
Reviews.Author: NJA1974
Reviews.Content: If you are the type that likes to feel a city as a local, this hotel is for you. A short walk into the city, this hotel is in the middle of a very affluent residential area of Rome. Breakfast is great, staff are helpful and friendly and the rooms large and comfortable. A good option to see the magic of Rome.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: An American living in Northwest England
Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MJP-22
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel which is nestled near the top of the Aventine Hill in Rome. Tucked in a lovely residential neighborhood, close to Santa Sabina Basilica and the Orange Grove Park. It would be a walk to the nearest shops and services, so count on taking a taxi to get anywhere, but the hotel itself has 21 beautifully decorated rooms (all different), a lovely garden, a patio for coffee or tea or drinks, and welcoming, friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “such a gorgeous property -- beautiful design and lovely quiet!”
Reviews.Author: kerryharrismail
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at the San Anselmo hotel after a long vacation that included a hectic four days in Rome, followed by a week in Tuscany -- it was our one night stop-over after Tuscany and before we headed back to Toronto and it didn`t disappoint! Quiet and elegant, beautiful neighbourhood, lovely rooms and a great breakfast all soothed our souls. The staff was great and very helpful -- do try Trattoria Bucatinie around the corner from the hotel -- it won`t disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “peaceful san anselmo”
Reviews.Author: vali186543
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel in late september and found the hotel to be well run with a lovely garden in a peaceful setting, there is a 10 minute walk (downhill) to reach any other facilities like cafes/shops etc. although we did not have a problem with this as we appreciated the quietness of the hotel, never ate at the hotel except for breakfasts which were buffet and a nice choice and if the weather is agreeable it is lovely to sit in the garden while breakfasting our rooms (ours was a standard room) were on the small side but pleasant and always kept very clean,we were fortunate enough to have a balcony, would I stay at this hotel again - definitely -

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Quiet Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TintininOz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel recently and it was one of the best places we stayed on our trip. The directions we received when booking were simple, clear and we didn't have any trouble catching the train from the airport to the nearest metro stop. From there is was a 5-10 min walk to the Hotel, either the Circo Maximo or Pyramid train station.... or 5-10 min taxi ride from Central Station (20euros) This Hotel is not in the centre of the action, but we liked this because it was in a lovely quiet inner city suburb, 1-2 train stops to the centre, and we got to really see the real Rome and local life, we loved hanging out eating Gelati's at the local park in San Anselmo. The Hotel is beautiful, with finishing touches in decor giving it real atmoshere. The Garden is lovely, breakfast in the mornings couldn't be a better start to the day. Breakfast consisted of different options - toast, boiled eggs, cold meat, cheese, pastries, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, cakes, biscuits, juice and coffee however you want. The staff are very friendly, helpful and happy to answer any questions. The rooms are beautifully decorated, with lovely views from the windows. Very comfortable, and very clean. I would reccommend this Hotel to anyone who likes that little bit of luxury at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “perfect retreat in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: nina m
Reviews.Content: Rome was our first stop on our 9 week europe trip. We weren't expecting Hotel San Anselmo to be perfect in every way, after all we booked it ourselves online through google searches, but it was. The service from the moment we arrived to the moment we left was friendly & faultless. The rooms immaculate, comfortable & very Italian! Breakfast was a feast enjoyed in a tranquil garden of shrubs & trees. We enjoyed a prosecco each night in the ambient courtyard. It was hard to believe we were in a city of almost 3 million. A picturesque 10minute walk to the Circus Maximus & further 15 minutes to the Colosseum. Beautiful restaurants full of locals are a 10 minute walk in the opposite direction. Highly recommend the relaxed deli local style Volpetti Piu €20 for a feast with wine! We will most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: anvas
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel located at a quiet residential area of Rome, still close to the city center. Wonderfully decorated rooms with classic elegance and style (looks like recently renovated with great taste). Very clean and well managed. Perfect sleep, especially if you prefer firm mattresses. If you get a room on the ground floor you are likely to get a private exit to the inner garden (good for smokers since all rooms are apparently non-smoking). Very good full breakfast either inside or in a beautiful private garden. Excellent restaurant for a evening meal in a hotel next door (must be under the same management). If you come as a tourist, you might find the hotel a bit far from main central attractions, but this keeps you away from noise and crowd. Will definitely come back for my next business trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but close to the action”
Reviews.Author: AussieinQ8
Reviews.Content: This quant little boutique hotel is very close to all the action and attractions of Rome, but in a very quiet upmarket suburb close to circus Maximus. This is not a well known hotel chain I.e. Westin etc. So what to accept??? I believe the building is a converted old Roman manor, It is small, it has reasonably good service, small but comfortable rooms, good bathrooms, good in-house restaurant around the corner, exclusively for house guests, breakfast in private garden, and a nice out door personalized cocktail bar. The BIG plus if u have a car..... FREE car parking!!!! As far as European hotels go, this place is VERY good value for money with a very "roman" homely feel. This will now be my regular Roman hotel, again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of tranquility”
Reviews.Author: fromthelandoflegends
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with another couple in late May of 2011. We had been to Rome several times befor and had stayed at major chain hotels as well as some of the smaller family run place (ie. The Hotel Locarno ). Everyone wants to be at the centre of the action but it sometimes comes with a cost - noise, heat, small rooms or high prices. The Hotel San Anselmo while not central is in an excellent location on a hill in a quiet neighbourhood overlooking the city. The walk to the Tiber (Trastevere) is perhaps 10 - 15 min. and about the same for the Forum and surrounding sights. We took a taxi a few times - going out to dinner near the Spanish Steps and after a full day of walking and ending up on the other side of town - it was approximately 12 to 15 euros. Returning to the hotel you gradually leave the hustle and noise of the city behind and enter and different would of leafy little streets and hidden gardens. Yes its true, you do wake to the sound of birdsong and i you a really lucky, as our friends were, to the sound of Gregorian Chant from the nearby monastery. Our room was on the top floor and overlooked the small shaded garden where we had a wonderful breakfast every morning. The rooms and all individually and tastefully decorated and the bathrooms excellent. Our friends found the night clerk to be a little aloof and distant ( they had a long flight with delays and really could have used a friendly face) but we had no problem withe the service and requests. I'm a fan of the smaller well run hotels and find the are an inportant part of the travel experience - The Hotel San Anselmo did not disapoint. Well done......

Reviews.Title: “Stay here every time we're in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 31Corso
Reviews.Content: We go to Rome at least twice a year and used to try different hotels. Not anymore--we've found perfection.. We love the San Anselmo, which is out of the major tourist area, but close enough to walk to them. This is a neighborhood hotel, one surrounded by quiet streets, beautiful parks and lovely homes. Excellent restaurants are also an easy walk as is public transportation. And the hotel itself is beautiful, with each room decorated in a different style, but all showing great taste. We love it and have booked it for future stays to be sure we can get our favorite room

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: FIN_CityTraveller
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a quiet place, yet with a easy connection to the historical center. In the morning you can hear birds singing, and yet in 20 minutes you can be walking in the packed tourists areas of Piazza Navona or Pantheon. The hotels proximity to Testaccio (5 min walk) means that you can have great lunch or dinner in the evening without the need to travel to the center. The local restaurants such as Da Felice (Via Mastro Giorgio, 29) or Degli Amici (Via Nicola Zabaglia, 25) offer much better value than the more touristy restraurants in the historical center. The rooms were nice and spacious, nothing extra special but without any flaws. Sleep quality was good mainly because of good beds, selection of pillows and good soundproofing. I would recommend this for anyone looking for a nice hotel in a less crowded area of Rome. However, it seems that the price per night varies a lot depending on the season, for a good value look for prices less than 150e. Similar hotels in the center often starts at 180/200e / night depending the season.

Reviews.Title: “Haven of tranquillity”
Reviews.Author: iamnotabanker
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here - San Anselmo was a perfect place to recover from the Rome crowds and heat in July. The walk to the Circo Massimo was like walking in the country - it was so quiet. Beautiful views of the city close by, interesting churches to visit nearby, inexpensive restaurants within easy walking distance........ we liked it a lot. Also we found staff incredibly client focused and helpful - complimentary fruit juice on arrival was a very pleasant surprise. In addition the reception staff were very helpful telling us where we could get tickets for a concert we wanted to see, and organising transfers to fiumicino as required. We also discovered that the hotel had a fantastic garden where a very peaceful breakfast was served; and could be used as a recovery place in the afternoon - with complimentary tea and the cakes left over from breakfast. Room was very good for a city hotel with a huge bathroom - a jacuzzi shower. Lots of windows. When in Rome, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CiaranIvory
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here for the last three nights of a two week break in Italy and it was the perfect place to end our visit. The room was spacious and clean and we loved the modernity and antique mixed style of the room. The bath/Jacuzzi was a big hit and staff we more than helpful and welcoming. Definitely one of the best hotels I ever visited and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the walk or the hype”
Reviews.Author: SuzannaG
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Rome so I pride myself on picking great places to stay. I was very off on this trip. Although it is nice to stay somewhat outside the center of the extreme Roman cloud of tourists, this hotel is just a little too far from all of the fun. The climb up the hill to the top of the Aventino although lovely to visit the "keyhole" is not so lovely at 11pm on the way back from dinner. The hotel itself is just fine. We had breakfast included but were NEVER made aware of it and therefore only realized it the last day. That basic example is a good idea of the absolute indifference of the staff. Except for one desk clerk/concierge all of the desk staff were unhelpful, apathetic and removed from the experience of being on vacation. They do NOTHING above and beyond, NOTHING helpful, NOTHING customer service focused. In an email requesting help in renting a car, two months prior to arrival, they said that it would be NO problem for them to arrange it when we arrived. I outlined clearly the needs and the locations we would be picking up and dropping it off. When we arrived and I inquired they said that they could not help as we will not be using their local rental company dropping it in Genova. Rooms not as clean as they could be, lots of grime on shower head and small. Will never return!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning in every way possible!”
Reviews.Author: Dermy100
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed at the beautiful Boutique Hotel San Anselmo, Rome last week (July 2011). From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were treated like royalty. The staff were exceptional (thanks again Vincenzo for everything!), our room was absolutely perfect with a beautiful view overlooking the Testaccio Neighbourhood and the location of the hotel is remarkable-a beautiful tranquil area of Rome and close to everything at the same time. We never usually make breakfast in the morning but after sampling the delicious spread put on every morning (included in the price of the room), we were sure to make it up for the rest of our stay. I simply cannot say enough good things about this stunning establishment! Thanks again for everything and we most certainly will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody Great”
Reviews.Author: Kesavaka
Reviews.Content: We simply loved Hotel San Anselmo! Terrific staff - courteous, helpful, prompt and efficient. The ambience is delightful, location great, breakfast very good. Wonderfully comfy place to return to after a day in Rome. Easy walking to a wide selection of restaurants. Our room was a delight. Made our visit to Rome all the more enjoyable. Good on you!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: B52s
Reviews.Content: First impressions count! On arrival at reception a cold glass of juice was a lovely welcome. We stayed here for three days in September. Our first floor room was a good size, warmly decorated in the baroque style, great bed and all very clean. Breakfast was taken in the small charming garden, continental style but good quality and plenty of choice. The peaceful location a little away from the hubbub of the city is ideal if you enjoy walking, but it is at the top of a small hill! (Great views of the city round the corner) The staff were all very attentive and friendly, overall a superb experience we reccomend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have been happier with our choice!”
Reviews.Author: Albino41
Reviews.Content: The San Anselmo is a wonderful hotel. We loved the location. Beautiful area of Rome. We loved walking around the area. The "keyhole" is around the corner and the beautiful Benedictine monastery across the street. A short walk down to the Rose Garden, Circus Maximus and the Colosseum. The room was very clean and spacious. The bathroom was exceptional by European standards. The breakfast was excellent with a great selection of meats, cheeses, breads, pastries, juice and cereals. We loved everything about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, excellent staff helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: jro504093
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet location, our room was small but well appointed, only complaint lacked any shelves or hooks in the bathroom. Staff friendly and helpful and a nice variety of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, warm and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterDC
Reviews.Content: Love the San Anselmo. It's perfectly nestled in a neighborhood within walking distance of many things including the Metro and train stations. The breakfast is excellent, the rooms are charming and comfortable and you feel like you're in a home. Also love the restaurant at the sister hotel around the corner. Don't hesitate, book here!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at a difficult time”
Reviews.Author: giudynando
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after living in Testaccio for an extended time. There is no other place in Roma, for me. It is quiet, beautiful, well-decorated, wi-fi, though it got off to a rocky start. And the bathroom with star lights on the ceiling was just what i needed - a clawfoot tub (also a little rocky from being unbalanced :)) The hotel and room were spotless, the breakfast spread generous. Alessandro was a poised, helpful gentleman with excellent English. My reservation had been confused but he made an adjustment to my bill and handled the situation with professionalism. The only difficulty was arrival - in the cold rain from a few blocks away. He warned me that he could try to call me a cab from my apartment (for my luggage), though could not guarantee one would come for me. I found one on my own, after much searching in the pouring rain, arriving at the hotel soggy. Allessandro looked ready to cry. :) I love the San Anselmo church, the monks, and this little part of Rome where my heart lives.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, a perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: lottielondon51
Reviews.Content: Contrary to recent reviews, our stay at San Anselmo was excellent. We arrived at San Anselmo exhausted early Saturday morning after using a shuttle service which was surprisingly quick and easy to use. We were greeted with a smile and were told our room was ready before normal check-in time which was such a relief due to our early flight. Our room was pretty with a roll top bath and four poster bed. We also had a small balcony (perfectly adequate) which overlooked the square outside. Here are the positives of our stay: -Very peaceful, no outside noise which I imagine you would get with a more central location -Large Bed (slightly hard) -Comfortable towels -Extremely accommodating and helpful hotel staff -Great Breakfast with real variety -Our room was always tidy and a freshly made bed was always present upon our return. -Despite other reviews, the walk to piramide station took 5-10 minutes and was a small price to pay for such a beautiful hotel location. Negatives of our stay: -Two single duvets on a king sized bed, we did not ask for this to be changed but it became extremely irritating. -Paying for television and internet (These should come as standard for this hotel price bracket) there is however Italian satellite television available for free -The heating would turn itself on to 24 degrees and made our room slightly warm -Cost of taxi; it would be good if the hotel ran some sort of reduced priced shuttle/ taxi service to over come this obvious annoyance for guests -The massage jets in our shower did not work All in all, a Great stay at Hotel San Anselmo, Please do not be put off by previous reviews, this is a lovely hotel- we will return! Please feel free to look at my partners blog as he has provided a detailed review of our trip to Rome www.blogzville.wordpress.com

Reviews.Title: “Good, but some of these reviews are skewed”
Reviews.Author: Captpablo
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rome three times and stayed in a different areas each time. My wife and I typically enjoy smaller, botique hotels in great neighborhoods. This hotel missed in several categories, but should be considered. Unlike previous reviewer whom wife was in tears we didn't have this issue. It's a nice hotel away from tourity areas. Overall, this is your standard Rome hotel. The staff where nice and accommodating. Rooms are adequate. Pros: Clean Good staff rooms are nice - we had one window that was oddly placed. decent bed nice outdoor and lobby space Cons: location - cab everywhere. Long walk to public transportation Nothing in the area, no bars or cafes to sit at Bar in lobby is open until 10. Pay for Internet

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: trini-in-ny
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a family friend that stayed there twice before and loved it. She could not have been more right. We chose Rome for our honeymoon and months of research and recommendations from friends and family we decided on San Anselmo. I emailed the hotel many (many) times before our arrival inquiring about New Years Eve and airport transfers and found the staff to be very helpful and responsive. We did not manage to pre-arrange out airport transfer as we were going to attempt to get there ourselves as our flight was getting in earlier enough to try. Unfortunately due to bad weather we missed our connection and had an ETA of 8PM in Rome. With nothing but my blackberry int'l data plan I managed to arrange over email with the hotel to have a car service pick us up at the airport. The transfer was quiet affordable and we were happy when we arrive Rome and saw a sign with our name. Upon arrival at the hotel we were greeted by pleasant reception staff who helped us settle up with the taxi driver for the agreed upon price as our Italian was none existent. Our room was great. The bathroom was amazing so much so I told my husband when we get a house I want to build a bathroom like the one in our room at the hotel. The heat worked great which was clutch as we visited in the height of winter. An additional plus was the bathroom had heated towel racks. On the first morning we stopped downstairs to inquire about the best way to get around Rome as our first stop was the Vatican. The front desk staff was very knowledgeable and gave us the best advice which was to take the bus. He told us where to get tickets and that the bus stop was right down the hill. (bus 23 took us to the Vatican in 10 mins and bus 3 or 280 took us to the Colosseum in 8 mins- we got a tourist 3 day unlimited pass for the bus for 11 Euro which was a deal) Breakfast- It was authentic and plentiful! We stayed for 4 Nights and 4.5 days and there was so much choice I did not have the opportunity to taste everything and believe me I tried. Cappuccinos each morning and a full breakfast allowed us to have a light lunch around 2pm and then a nice dinner. The Hotel is also quite close (15 min walk along the river) to Traverse in Rome which is located on the opposite side of the river. The Traverse is a long street with many restaurants and bars. My husband and I ate at a different restaurant there each night. The food was great and affordable which was a pleasant surprise as we were told it would be expensive to eat in Rome. Honestly I did not think the prices were bad as they were quite comparable to the value you could get in NYC restaurants (not the expensive ones). The hotel was also very close the the "Jewish Ghetto" which had another strip of restaurants. We ate at Giggetto al Portico d'Ottavia which was the best meal we had in Rome. One of the sites close to the San Anselmo is the keyhole which is beyond amazing. I won't say what you will see but ask the front desk to point you in the right direction and check it out. The surrounding area of the hotel was a quite, safe, clean residential area. My husband and I walked around and also identified the other hotels owned by the same chain in the same area. Without a doubt we will visit San Anselmo or one of its sister hotels in the future. We listened to the reviews on trip advisor in addition to our friend's recommendation and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overrated”
Reviews.Author: greece4ever
Reviews.Content: San Anselmo seemed like a nice alternative to most of the typical Italian hotels of Rome. In some aspect it was. It's newly renovated, and with ok service, but most of the good things end there. The renovation wasn't the most precisious, with results like some faulty fixtures etc. Rooms are on the small size, although clean and fresh, and breakfast is quite limited. Bear in mind that its location isn't the most practical one, especially for a first time visitor in Rome. If you want somewhat good value, an italian flair and character, without the amenities and standards of a 5 star hotel, then S. Anselmo fits the bill quite nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit just as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Connie072
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the first time 2 years ago and found it excellent. The staff were friendly and welcoming and the reception staff very helpful. We came back with friends last month and were pleased to find that the same staff were still there and that yet again nothing was too much trouble - from welcoming us at reception with a tray of cold drinks to sending up a tray of wine and strawberries for my Birthday. It is in a lovely peaceful square away from the traffic so that getting a good night's sleep is not a problem. The breakfasts are excellent with plenty of choice and good service. The walk down the hill into the centre of Rome is OK in the morning but in the evening we tended to get a taxi back. They are not too expensive especially if there are 4 of you. The room was pleasant and the beds comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sommelier4travel
Reviews.Content: We have visited Rome many times, and never had as nice a stay as we did at Hotel Sant' Anselmo. We stayed with our 18 month old, and think the hotel is just as fitting for a family with young children as it is for a couple. The service was gracious, and the atmosphere very elegant and relaxing. We have already recommended the hotel to several of our friends traveling to Rome next year. Thank you Sant' Anselmo for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average but got the worst room in the house”
Reviews.Author: mat101010
Reviews.Content: I truly believe this is a good hotel for Rome. It is located in a quiet and upscale neighborhood about 10-15 minutes walking distance from the major landmarks. Perched up on a hill, the hotel rooms and near by parks offer wonderful views of everything but downtown Rome. The attempt to add a unique design element was welcome in the location/price completive city. However, the room given was of rather poor taste and didn't befit the otherwise wonderful hotel. We never did spend any time in the room anyway so I consider this to be a non-issue but some honeymooners might want to request their desired room to avoid any letdowns. As a side note, we also stayed at the Portrait Suites hotel located above the Salvatore Ferragamo store on the Via dei Condotti shopping boulevard. While the price was twice as high, it was more than twice the hotel. Check it out if you want something one-of-a-kind. http://www.lungarnohotels.com

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Quiet Place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Audrey070
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary in Italy! Returning to Rome from Positano for our last night stay in Italy we received a warm friendly welcome from the Hotel San Anselmo. Our "room of one thousand kisses" was romantic, elegant, spacious and included all amenities. We were pleasantly surprised to find a beautiful arrangement of champagne, glasses and nuts including best wishes for our celebration . Alessandra greeted us and was pleasantly helpful and patient in finding the Camponeschi restaurant, which was exactly how we wanted to festively celebrate our last night in Italy with excellent delicious outdoor dining in the Piazza Farnese, the capitol area of Rome. Aventino Hill is a quaint upscale residential tree lined neighborhood. We strolled the streets taking in all the aromas, sights, sounds and senses of Italy. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast at the lovely serene garden before our departure. The yummiest cappuccino with the heart in it was very sweet! The San Anselmo was definitely an exquisite hotel to stay and a must for all who are visiting Rome. Much thanks to all the staff for a memorable visit! —Audrey and Ed, Philadelphia PA

Reviews.Title: “A great end to a fabulous honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ViviDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a 10 day honeymoon in Italy - it was the perfect ending. The hotel were aware that it was our honeymoon and upgraded us to a suite and had champagne and strawberries waiting for us. The staff at reception were great and gave us great tips for seeing the city. The location is a bit of out the centre but it's within walking distance of the Colosseum, as well as Trastevere. In fact, the lesser-known sites around the hotel are well worth a visit! I highly recommend this to visitors to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel that embodies the romance of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: kgooge
Reviews.Content: Such a perfect hotel to experience Italian hospitality. The staff, especially Alessandro, is so accommodating. The location on the sleepy street is so beautiful and secluded but is a short walk to the bus. Ask for a room with a balcony if possible. The decor and grounds are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional quality, service and value - Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PADIgrl
Reviews.Content: I found Sant Anselmo online and we booked it online months and months before our trip. They had a special at that time that offered a 25% discount if the room was paid for in full at the time of booking. I was nervous about booking online and so we did so through our travel agent. Everything worked out perfectly. They responded promptly to any email inquiries that we had before we left as well. The hotel is stunning. We wanted a small luxury hotel that had modern amenities but still had some Italian flair and this hotel more than met our expectations. We had a large suite (not what we were expecting for the price that we paid) and it was beautiful and very well-appointed - marble, jacuzzi, four poster king bed, flat screen tv, and the list goes on. The staff were friendly and professional and assisted us with bookings for museums. Breakfast was also included with the price of the room. We found the location to be perfect as well. It is out of the din of the tourist attractions and yet, a stone's throw from the Circus Maximus where you can catch any of the city tour buses or the metro. It is located in a very nice residential area of Rome. We really wanted to experience the "local" culture and so one of the things that we liked the most about this hotel was that it was located only a few minutes walk from Testaccio - where you can have some superb local Roman cuisine without the tourist prices. There is absolutely nothing negative that we could say about the Hotel Sant Anselmo. We had a wonderful experience and will be staying there again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel... Just Hard To Navigate on Foot”
Reviews.Author: sexytigeress112
Reviews.Content: The place is beautiful. The room gorgeous. The staff great and the breakfasts wonderful. But we did not plan on taking taxis around town. It's on one of Rome's famous hills... meaning a lot of walking at the end of a long day on foot for the explorer type traveller. But I would definitely stay here again... and plan for cab fare!

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil retreat in the beautiful Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: SarahO1070
Reviews.Content: Overall: If you're coming to Rome - stay here you shouldn't be disappointed. All the positives in the previous reviews we found to be true - this place is a wonderful example of a small independent boutique hotel - so don't expect an in-house restaurant and all the usual formulaic trimmings of a 5 star chain hotel like a Hilton or Marriott! Cost: Great value for money for Rome at average of €205 / £170 per night for a Deluxe Room. We booked via hotel website Splendia.com and found this best price on web for our dates. Our room: We had room #825 - the Poetry Room. Beautiful room with own small balcony overlooking the piazza at front of hotel. The staff: The booking staff by email were incredibly helpful, not to mention patient - as I made several requests back and forth for specific rooms and asked what facilities they had like balcony, four poster etc. They even emailed photos of the rooms. We did not find front desk staff unhelpful - they were professional and cultural differences may make some people feel they are unfriendly. However, they couldn't do more to help with our questions on how to get to attractions, where to eat for a special birthday meal and arranging transfer back to the airport (Mercedes private taxi company at €40 one way - recommended). The two bar men were so charming and serve up late night drinks to enjoy in the lounge or front terrace with a warm smile and good humour. A brilliant way to finish off each evening! We received complimentary sparkling wine and strawberries on arrival and for the day of my birthday - really lovely touch. The location: It was incredibly hot during our stay (32/33 degrees each day) so the walk uphill was more hard work, despite us being young(ish!) and fit. If you are visiting during the cooler months this will be less of an issue. It takes approx 15 minutes to walk to Travestere, 20-25 minutes to walk to the Colliseum and around 30-40 minutes to stroll to the central area of Campo F’iori/Piazza Navona/Pantheon etc. We simply took taxis back from Travastere and Campo F’iori(€9/11 respectively) to save the legs and indigestion after a meal with lovely local wine! Places to eat: We didn't pick Testaccio for eating out as we felt it lacked any charm for romantic meals out. We were visiting for my 40th birthday weekend so wanted places with a terrace or looking over a pretty piazza. But several local restaurants get a write up in Lonely Planet. PS - Be sure to visit the Volpetti deli (Testaccio) – lovely charactful place and they give you loads of free samples. We bought some tasty olives to enjoy on our terrace. Wanting to eat out - fear not! It is a pleasant 15 minute walk downhill to the wonderful Travestere area (head right out of the hotel - walk down the cobbled pathway just past the Orange Park - and across the Ponte Palatino) where you will find a fantastic choice of relaxed and reasonably priced trattorias, bars and restaurants. Make sure you walk a good distance in for the best choice. We found Travastere best value area to eat in, compared to Campo F'iori/Piazza Farnesse which was lovely setting but more expensive. We went there on the night of my birthday. Can recommend restaurant "Osteria ar Galleto" - head into Piazza Farnesse and it is tucked in the right hand corner by the alleyway. Fab atmosphere (lots of Italians eating there too), not too expensive, funny and charming waiting staff. Real slice of Rome on a plate!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice option for Rome”
Reviews.Author: KeroroGunso
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 2 night in June. The location is a tad out of the way. Very easy though to find and next to the circus maximus and the forum. The hotel is classy and very well done. The breakfast room is impressive and sophisticated. Our room was outstanding. Very modern but with an elegant style. Bathroom was fantastic and spacious. We even had our own terrace. I have absolutely no reservations about this hotel and I am very particular about 4 to 5 star hotels. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A nurturing, quiet, beautiful villa hotel”
Reviews.Author: teeaar
Reviews.Content: My son and I had a glorious stay at the Sant Anselmo. They really took care of us, providing us with a beautiful room with poetry on the walls, clean elegant accommodations, warm, cordial service. We not only slept well there, but had great dreams. The bathroom was large, with all new fixtures and marble walls. The breakfasts in the garden were super--the food so fresh, the hot chocolate a delight for my son. The location was ideal for us--a quiet, residential area, close to good restaurants and a lovely walk to the attractions. The staff is wonderful at the desk, via email, and serving us at breakfast. We were sad to have to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, basic everything else!”
Reviews.Author: babs777
Reviews.Content: I booked this based on a recommendation from The Times. The rooms are gorgeous and the hotel itself is very stylish in a quiet area not too far from the colloseum and circus maximus. However i dont think that it was good value for money. We stayed in a deluxe double which cost 261 per night for what is basically a B&B stay with a very basic breakfast. We needed to print boarding passes but were told to go to their sister hotel S.Pietro around the block... in the pouring rain. Again we had to go to S.Pietro for an evening meal (fantastic deserts there by the way). The 2 male receptionists were not ideally suited to a front of house job with their extremely unwelcoming manner. They also refused to allow me to use the iron my room ans insisted I iron in the basement which is normally a staff only area. They let the hotel down in my opinion. I love the style of these hotels though and would probably go back to stay in hotel san pietro with more facilities and much friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “I had to write this review because the bad reservation service was shocking!”
Reviews.Author: SarahParis
Reviews.Content: I have worked in the travel industry, and travel in the EU on a monthly basis to various major cities, staying in boutique hotels, B&Bs and other quality accommodations. After a three-week search on where the ideal spot to stay in Rome would be, Hotel S Anselmo was at the top of our list. We chose three others as back-up in case they did not have availability for the dates we selected. I read all of the reviews very carefully and loved the hotel website. I sent off my email inquiry to reserve for October 2010. The hotel website reservation service did not work when I tried twice to use it. In addition, the packages available had unclear information. I wanted to talk to someone at the hotel and see what they could recommend to fit our stay in Rome. What I got back in response was this: The rate right now is 270 euros (I wanted the rate for October). Send me your credit card details. See our website for promotions (I had specified the promotion was unclear that I needed their help). Ok, so I respond again – politely – asking the rates for October, confirmation of the room details (is there a balcony, etc) and specific recommendations on their package for a 4-day stay. Two days go by and someone else responds: Check our website and send us your credit card details. And so on and so on until I just gave up. The responses we got from other hotels in Rome were impeccable, with full details, cancellation policy, package recommendations and even airport pick-up information. We chose one in particular, the Palm Gallery, which is just outstanding service-wise. Why was it so hard for Hotel S Anselmo to take two minutes out of their day to help us book our reservation properly? I do not know but it left a bad taste in my mouth and we will not ever go there. This is my own personal experience and perhaps the hotel really is top-notch, as the other reviews say, but I find it hard to start off on such a rude basis when we were about to put down over a thousand euros for a hotel that is not even city-center. If this is the treatment we got before we were even in the door, I can’t be bothered to go further. This review is a just as a heads-up to other travelers. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: LondonKristen
Reviews.Content: Our stay at S Anselmo was special. From the moment we arrived the staff took great care of us and the room was perfect. The renovation of the hotel has to be one of the best examples of modern interior design in a classic building. This is not style for style sake rather a modern twist which is distinctive and fresh. Located in Aventino the hotel is an oasis of calm and tranquility. The breakfast is impressive and offers a wide selection of meats, cheese, fresh bread and fruit. The hotel restaurant located in a nearby sister hotel is not up to the 5 star standard of the S Anselmo at least on the night we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique style hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Sara187791
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely and staff were very helpful. Just a couple of tube stations away from the Colossum - we found that Piramide was the best station to walk to from the hotel. We booked a delux double room and were not disappointed - super king size bed!. After walking all day in Rome (which is very busy in May) we came back to quiet and tranquility and a jacuzi bath which was very welcome. Sister hotel just around the corner provides evening restaurant. However suggest going to find local restaurants which provide fantastic food. If I was going to visit Rome again I would definately stay in this hotel again as it was just what we like and that combined with a fantastic city to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary was just great. Breakfast offered lots to choose from. Only disappointment was the sandwiches which we ordered at the hotel for lunch before we left for the airport. - small toasted cheese sandwiches - that's all they could do and very expensive for what they were.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great staff - lovely location - what more can I say?!”
Reviews.Author: dcad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very lovely area just to the south of the very centre of Rome, an upscale residential area but which is also very close to restaurants, sightseeing points, etc. It certainly is not remote from the centre of Rome, as it is quite easy (and cheap) to get a taxi to the local metro station or to such attractions as the Coliseum, or simply walk. The staff could not be faulted for anything, being very helpful and yet discrete - the front desk staff could not be more accommodating with any request. The hotel serves a very nice breakfast, which should be eaten outside in the back garden if the weather permits. While not having its own restaurant for dinner, the sister Hotel San Pio around the corner is a good spot for dinner (maitre d' is Stefano). The hotel staff will also recommend many good restaurants within walking distance in the area - be sure to try Trattoria de Bucatino on Via Luca Della Robbia, which looks very plain from outside but is one of those great family-run neighbourhood restaurants where the locals go for good honest Italian food. The rooms in the hotel are absolutely lovely - make sure to upgrade if you can get a reasonable rate, as it is certainly worth the extra money, even given the fact that the standard rooms are still superior to most hotels. As a recommendation, I would suggest strolling along to the wooden gate of the adjacent Order of Malta headquarters, which gives you a narrow view directly across Rome to the Vatican via a hole in the gate itself, and then taking a walk through the nearby orange tree park (ask at the hotel reception for directions) to get a great view of Rome from a height. Then go back out of the park itself and take the walkway running parallel to the park, which brings you down to the river - walk 600-700 metres along the riverbank, and either catch the 23 bus to the Vatican or stroll across the pedestrian bridge (Ponte Fabricio) on to the Isola Tiberina, and on from there to the rest of Rome... I would certainly highly recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to visit Rome but who wants to avoid the hustle and bustle, and yet be close to all of the sightseeing activity.

Reviews.Title: “Do not even consider any other hotel in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Bahar_Adem
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this charming hotel for our honeymoon in the Summer of 2008. My husband made his decision by looking at its reviews in Trip Adviser, and I'm glad he did so. All good things that have been said about this place, they are true. First of all, it is located in a very quiet, upscale residential area. The building itself used to be a private villa before being turned into a hotel. But don't think that it is in a remote area; we could walk from the hotel to the T-station (and the next station is Colosseum) in about 10 minutes. And it is a very nice walk. If you take a cab from the hotel, it takes 10 minutes to the central Rome, for 7-8 Euros. The room we stayed was beautifully furnished. Oh and the bathroom... Beautiful red marbles and the luxurious shower area are what I remember. Usually I'm disgusted to use hotel bathrooms no matter how clean they look, but I felt very comfortable in this place. The only possibly negative thing I can say about the room is the fact that they joined two twin beds to make a bed for two. You could feel the gap between the beds when lying. But we were so captured by all the other nice things about the hotel, it did not bother us that much. This was also mentioned in the hotel reviews, so we expected that. They offer a rich breakfast in their peaceful backyard. Breakfast included tea, coffee, cheese and jam varieties, boiled eggs, cherry tomatoes, butter, honey, Nutella, cereal, etc. However, they do not have a restaurant to offer dinner. Still not a problem. They have a sister hotel in 5 minute walk: Hotel Villa San Pio. We had dinner there two nights and it was great. It was also very romantic to walk back to our hotel after the dinner. I don't understand why some people told in their reviews that the staff were negligent. They were very kind to us. So in all, we were very satisfied by our experience in Hotel San Anselmo. We can't wait to go back and stay there again. I say, don't even search for other hotels. This is the place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: archbeatus
Reviews.Content: beautiful location and interior design, very good and reach breakfast. The only negative thing we found was that the room was a bit small for us. The staff are very friendly and helpful and we'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So near .. and yet so far. .”
Reviews.Author: turkey222
Reviews.Content: Expensive and considered, this hotel is eay on the eye, both exterior and interior; rooms and public areas. But as with so many 'modernised/renovated' European hotels, underneath the designer exterior and gimmicks, there is absolutely no infrastructure to support a good night's sleep. No sound proofing at all, doors banging, corridor clearly audible at all times and many lights from all the fancy electrical switches in the room. It is such a shame. An expensive one if you're paying the hotel's standard rates. In light of this, and if you want a good night's sleep, this hotel may not be what you're after.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh, smell the orange blossoms. This quiet spot amongst leafy villas and rose gardens restores the soul.”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaWanderer
Reviews.Content: We learned of this hotel from my husband's business friend who lives in northern Italy and visits family in this neighborhood. We wanted a place that would suit our party of three couples staying in Rome for several days at the end of a cruise. This place completely filled the bill, and was described by some of our party as the best part of our Roman stay. Those of us who weren't keen on traipsing all day welcomed the away-from-the-bustle location, and spent time relaxing in the garden or exploring the neighborhood. This area is home to embassies, old churches, walled garden villas, schools and monasteries. The walkers among us weren't much daunted by the south-of-the-Roman-Forum location, although there were days when we just plain quit walking and called a cab to get back to the hotel. I'd say this hotel does not see itself as primarily a tourist hotel. Guests in the breakfast room appeared to come from many continents, and were not (as we were) perusing their guidebooks. Each day staff at the front desk helped us find and make reservations at local restaurants, but it seemed to me that hand-holding with tourists might not be a favorite duty. We walked to the sister hotel's restaurant (good, moderate prices) and also Apuleius restaurant (good but expensive). We also walked down the hill, along the river and across the Ponte Palatine to Trastevere for more casual, reasonably-priced restaurants. Owner and staff were willing to negotiate a lower rate for three rooms, and arranged for a driver and a no-frills minivan to meet us at the cruise ship port to transport us and lots of luggage to the hotel for a reasonable price. If you stay at Sant'Anselmo, be sure to visit one of my all-time favorite churches, the early-Christian-era Santa Sabina (ca. 432) set in a lovely rose garden. The carved wooden doors may have inspired the later bronze doors of Bishop Bernward at Hildesheim (1015).

Reviews.Title: “ok, but seriously overpriced for no facilities”
Reviews.Author: CrecentMoon
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel, because it was close to where we were having meetings. Its reviews here and in guides were very positive. so we were ok with it, but overall I felt that it is worth putting another view forward as I felt that its shortcomings are not fully highlighted. In fairness, I'd have to say it was ok, the rooms were nicely decorated, but mine was extremely small (just space to walk around the bed). Other rooms where much bigger with balconies and seperate rooms etc... the mad thing is they are all the same price. So book very carefully, as a box is charged the same as a suite. Second it is expensive. The room rate we paid was almost EUR 300 per night, which frankly you expect a lot for. We didnot get that, and as a regular hotel travellor, i think it is vastly, and I mean vastly over-priced. Third it is dirty. They have all sorts of fancy bubble baths, and showers, but it is all old and worn, not well maintained and just dirty if you look closely. No-one really loves this place ensure that the high standards are really high. Everything was ok, but just not more than that. Fourth it doesn't have a dining room ! That would be ok for a b&b for for an expensive "luxury" hotel it is not to be believed that no evening meals are available. They recommend a series of other restaurants, but sometimes that is not what you are looking for. It does do a good breakfast spread, with fresh and wide range of foods, and when we arrived late one morning, they kept it out for us (which was nice) but again no wow-points from me, as that is what I pay the huge amount of money for. The staff are curtious and fine - no complaints, but nothing amazing either. the area is residential villas on a hill above Rome. The next square is one of the best insider tips in Rome, it houses the HQ of the Order of Malta (a unique organisation with sovereign status, which means that their Villa is like the vatican - not part of italy). If you look through the keyhole you have an amazing view through three countries (the Order of Malta, Italy and the Vatican) and see the dome of St Peters. Pretty cool. not that the hotel told us it was there, of course, but we discovered it of our own accord. so, in summary, I know that Rome is expensive for hotels, but you pay a lot here, soif you are a seasoned and demanding travellor you'll be unimpressed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a quiet corner of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ejschneiter
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this wonderful little hotel was great from start to finish. Located at the peak of the hill in Aventino, it is situated in a lush, shady and quiet neighborhood of Rome - attributes hard to find in that otherwise totally frenetic city. The hotel is on Piazza S. Anselmo - a block away is a park of orange trees from which you can look out over the city, and the "keyhole" gate at the Order of the Malta Knights - don't miss peeking through that on a clear night to see an incredible view of St Peter's! From the moment we entered the hotel's small foyer, we were impressed with the attention to detail. Decorated with a lovely, quirky and a tad bit funky eye, the surroundings are welcoming and comforting. Every member of the staff was attentive and helpful -- even to the point of noticing it was Jack's birthday (from his passport, I guess) during our stay and sending champagne up to the room to mark the occasion! Breakfast was fine and the cappucino delicious (foam in the shape of a heart in every cup!). The best part, though, was sitting in the garden with a paper each morning - what a treat. Getting to the hotel was the only difficulty we had, having driven to Rome from Puglia, dropping the car at the airport, taking the train to the Termini station and then taking a taxi from the station to the hotel (and getting ripped off by the taxi driver -- be sure the drivers turn on the meter...they seem to like making up fares for the tourists) was a trial. But once in our room, we were rewarded. Each room is decorated differently -- ours was in shades of burgundy, with long flowing curtains in the tall window. Parquet flooring and a bathroom to die for -- chandelier, a bronze tiled, massive soaking tub/shower -- luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a quiet part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ox0nian
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sant'Anselmo as we wanted a quiet hotel which was not too far from the historic centre of Rome. The hotel is in a leafy residential area on the Aventine hill and there are several historic churches in the vicinity. However there are no shops, bars or cafes. The rooms are themed in a rather theatrical style; the overall ambience is quietly efficient and elegant. The staff are discreetly attentive and service is very good. The hotel is at the top of a steep hill and the walk back is daunting at the end of a long day's sightseeing. There is no restaurant, although evening meals can be taken in the garden restaurant at the hotel's sister establishment, the San Pio, which is in the next street. This is quite an expensive option, but the only alternative is to descend the hill again and find a restaurant in the narrow streets of the Testaccio area (and then face the walk back up again!). Overall a very good hotel - but before you book, just be aware that the hilltop location does have some drawbacks as well as many advantages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler1951
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. Our room was beautiful and well appointed and overlooked the lovely garden patio. The staff was helpful and gracious. We especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet and having a quiet morning meal in a beautiful outdoor garden. Although a little bit of a hike to get up the hill to this hotel it is quiet, serene and a haven from the noise of the city. A short 15 minute walk from the coliseum and convenient to the metro, buses and all other locations. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPearnz
Reviews.Content: San Anselmo is a lovely, quaint hotel in the exclusive embassy/villa quarter of Rome. Walking distance to the Forum/Colosseum but not as central as probably most would like. We actually found that to be a bonus but you did have to figure you way around on public transport. The hotel's decor is lovely - boroque but contemporary at the same time. We were blessed to get a 'room with a view' - 3rd floor with it's own terrace overlooking the rooftops of Rome. A lovely night or two sat out there sharing a bottle of Italy's vino - very romantic. As long as you're prepared to walk and know it's uphill on the return, it's well recommended. Be careful on the restaurants they suggest though - we had a very mediocre and rude experience at an expensive fish restaurant close to the hotel. Live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful service just a bit of a walk!”
Reviews.Author: c_foulk
Reviews.Content: San Anselmo is the most beautiful hotel we have ever stayed in. We stayed in the 'Room for Romace' and it was lovely. The decor was stunning and there was a jucazzi bath, mini bar, safe, TV/internet, comfortable bed etc. The servicce from the staff was very efficient and the breakfast was lovely. We stayed here for our honeymoon and despite arriving at 12am there was chilled champagne waiting on our arrival! The hotel is in a lovely quiet area but the only downside to this is that it is a minimum 20 minute walk to more or less anywhere really and there isn't anywhere clode-by to eat at night but don't let this put you off. A truly memorably stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: goju
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights in this great hotel in Rome. Situated uphill in a beautiful neighbourhood consisting mainly of Foreign Embassy's, only 15-20 minutes walk to the Trastevere area for excellent dining and about the same distance to the Colosseum. Stylish rooms and common areas and lovely gardens, excellent breakfast served in the garden or dining area. Most of the staff are are very nice, some of the reception staff are a little cold but everything else is so good it's a small negative in a very big positive. Highly recommended in every aspect with only one exception being if you are unfit the walk back from the city centre may prove to be a bit of an obsticle.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: MackenziesOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and weren't able to check-in prior to the normal time, but they were able to hold our bags, which was nice. The front desk person was not very personable and referred us to a horrible tour company-Carrani Tours. The tour was the worst part of our trip to Rome. The sitting area off of our room and in front of the hotel was our favorite part of the hotel, although the jacuzzi tub was also nice. We had to walk a good 10-15 minutes just to get to the nearest metro. It was well decorated and had a romantic atmosphere, with a touch of elegance.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful posh gorgeous room”
Reviews.Author: le_pseudonyme
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite possibly the best in Rome. Each room differs in theme/design (different decor, paint color, furnishings, linens etc.). We stayed in the "Manhattan e Bramante" room, and it was gorgeous. The bed was comfortable. It was air conditioned. Our bathroom had all the amenities--even a whirlpool bath. We had a balcony. We never wanted to leave! Close to the colosseum and every historical site. we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, elegant, charming.”
Reviews.Author: devgarrison
Reviews.Content: After going back and forth from review to review on several sites we settled on Hotel S. Anslemo and we weren't disappointed. We were looking for a place to stay before and after a cruise out of Civitavechia that was close enough to attractions without the noise of the city and this was perfect. Our rooms were lovely. The first night we had a smaller room with a king bed and a large bathroom. On our return they "upgraded" us to a much larger room with a lavish bathroom. We felt like we were staying in a private villa. The nearest metro station is Pyramide. I would recommend taking a cab to the hotel though from the station as it's on a hill and with heavy luggage I would be a hike. The streets are one way but the local cab drivers know their way around and we were treated in a very fair manner by them. Taxi drivers from Termini might not and we were ripped off a bit (a common theme in tourist destinations.) The breakfast and private garden are a wonderful way to start the day. We dined in the sister hotel for dinner mainly as we were very tired. The food was good although the menu limited. They too have a nice garden dining area that was quiet and romantic. We found all staff memebers to be friendly and helpful. I plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, elegant, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah77777
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this wonderful hotel for 5 nights. The hotel is a beautiful, small hotel in the quiet, upscale neighborhood on Aventine hill. It feels like a Villa that has been converted to a hotel. There is a beautiful garden courtyard where you can eat breakfast or have a glass of wine at night. The rooms are elegant and so comfortable (reminded me of the rooms in the Mark Hopkins Hotel in San Francisco). The staff provides fantastic service, and because it is a small intimate hotel, you interact with the same staff everyday. Breakfast is excellent -- fruit, meats, bread, croissants, cheese, hardboiled eggs, yogurt, cereal. It is the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in! Accessibility: It is convenient to everything, if you are fit for walking, and a nice quiet retreat from the heart of the city. It is about a 15 minute walk to the Colosseum, and about a 10 minute walk to bus and metro stops. There is a neighborhood about 10 minutes away with good restaurants and shops for takeout food.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, quietness and quality - far from the madding crowds.”
Reviews.Author: TandJLancashire
Reviews.Content: If you want to escape the noisy madness and traffic of Rome, the Hotel San’t Anselmo is the ideal place. Situated on the Aventine hill (well worth the uphill climb!!), in a leafy piazza, it offers an excellent, quiet location and a high quality, but expensive experience. The hotel is about a 10 minutes’ walk from Via Marmorata, where there is easy access to both the excellent bus service & metro. All sites are readily accessible by walking or bus. The Vatican is probably the furthest away, but still can be walked to along the River Tiber in 45 minutes or reached easily on the 23 bus. The hotel quality is excellent, with lovely, quiet, well appointed and air conditioned rooms. The Hotel’s front desk staff, whilst perhaps giving an initial impression of being somewhat cold, were actually professional, efficient & helpful whenever asked for assistance. The buffet breakfast is high quality and continental in style, with a wide menu choice, but you will not find an attempt at an ‘English breakfast’.
