The adjacent Hotel San Pio has a lovely dining room for dinner & or you can eat outside in the lovely hotel grounds. If you decide to eat out, then ignore guide books which advise you to eat in Testaccio (which we found quite run down & not pleasant), but cross the Pont Sublicio bridge and head into Trastevere which has a number of good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “"Lovely hotel, let down by a few problems"”
Reviews.Author: doggusmaximus
Reviews.Content: As previously mentioned by others, the hotel is in a great location - on a quiet piazza, only a 20-minute stroll down the hill into the thick of things - and in a really beautiful part of Rome that you probably wouldn't get to see otherwise, given it's not slap bang in the centre. Both the common areas and the rooms (at least the one we were in - 831, the Mirror Room) are really lovely - OK, so our room wasn't the biggest, but it was big enough and certainly didn't feel cramped. Breakfast (outside in the garden when we were there in mid-May) is fantastic.The overall impression is romantic and elegant, and we enjoyed our stay. But - is it worth the price we paid (270 euros per night)? On balance, not quite. First, even though all rooms are advertised as having air-con, it's really pretty feeble compared to (far less expensive) hotels I've stayed at elsewhere. As a result, the room never really dropped to a temperature that I would call comfortable. And remember we went in mid-May, when the weather was 27 degrees (that's about 82 degrees ) - I imagine in mid-summer, when the temperature can hit close to 40, it must get pretty unbearable. Mainly, though, as others have mentioned on this site, we were really disappointed - angry, in fact - with the attitude of the front-desk staff. We also experienced the general sense of apathy when we checked in, and on the odd occasion that we needed some information. Worse, though - we needed internet access during our stay, but our in-room internet connection wasn't working. The front desk seemed totally unconcerned by this, suggesting that we walk to another hotel to use their internet - despite the fact that the front desk had internet access on a computer right there, and could easily have let us use it for two minutes. At the other hotel we had to hang around waiting for the sole computer terminal to come free. Are these big issues? Not really, no. But after having paid a fair chunk of money for a room, I would have expected better all-round service than this. It's these small things that make the difference between a good experience and a great one. Would we recommend it? Yes, but with reservations. Would we go back there? Maybe - but I'd also shop around to see if any better options presented themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Decor”
Reviews.Author: lifeofriley
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in March. Loved the hotel. We stayed in the Poesy room with italian love poems on the wall and chandelier, very romantic. The public rooms of the hotel were beautifully done as well. We like to stay in off the beaten path spots, and this hotel is tucked away in a residential area on aventine hill. While it was very quiet, I do agree with other reviewers that at the end of a long day on foot, its a long walk up the hill! The only reservation we had about the hotel was that compared to the two other hotels we stayed at in tuscany and venice, we felt the staff was a bit cool and not overly helpful. Also, the restaurant that was recommended for dinner was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shellsey77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in Jan 2008 for 3 nights and it was fantastic. I am so glad that I just fell upon on it after an extensive internet search. Hotels in central Rome are very expensive. I found this one based on our budget and then read the positive views here on trip advisor. I have to say it was one of the best hotels that we have stayed in on a city break and we have stayed in alot of European cities. First of all its tucked away and not that easy to find...think we got ripped off by the taxi driver as he didnt understand the one way system near the hotel...but when we did get there we were glad of the secluded location as it means you are in a quiet residential area away from all the noise of the city but only a 20 minute walk from the colliseum. The staff were friendly and showed us to our fantastic room- outside the back of the hotel called the vanity suite! ( And we never requested a suite and got it for the standard price- maybe because it was out of season- we never asked why!) It was wonderful- spacious and well appointed but the bathroom blew us away- it was under the bedroom and all lit up with a huge sunk roman bath- amazing! We had great breakfasts in the hotel...varied range of continetal goodies. In the evening a lovely glass of cava in the small cosy bar area. All in all I love this hotel- its trendy and glam in an understated way and all for only 120 euros a night...probably gone up now but I would still go back! As it was in a quiet area the hotel gave us a list of local restaurants and we had some fun at these local tratatorias with no menus or price guides!! All in all a fantastic break and I recommend this hotel to anyone I hear going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A real treat!”
Reviews.Author: Fluffalicious
Reviews.Content: We went here for a major birthday celebration and we were more than happy with every aspect. The decor of the hotel is just stunning. Our room was delightful, with hand-painted frescoes; the lounge, dining room and halls ways are sumptuous. The atmosphere therefore is great. It's situated in a lovely quiet bit of Rome, surrounded by ancient cathedrals, houses and orange groves. It takes about 20 minutes to walk into the centre, but that was a lovely walk, and also nice to be away from the traffic noise etc. Breakfasts were delicious. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, just loved it”
Reviews.Author: edinburghduo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 2 night break to the city. I booked the hotel after seeing the reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. It was just beautiful, quiet but only 15 minute walk to the Colloseum. The staff were incredibly helpful and wouldnt hesistate to recommend. When we go back to Rome, it has to be there.

Reviews.Title: “beutiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: linTel_Aviv
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for 3 nights to celebrate my wife's birthday and it couldn’t be better! The hotel is beautiful! The rooms are lovely, very romantic, and well designed. Breakfast was very good either. The hotel is located in a beautiful neighborhood, 20 minutes walk from the coliseum. 5 minutes walking north east from the hotel you can find a nice garden with a stunning view on the city. Don’t miss it! We think that the location, which is a bit far from the center, is an advantage. It is far from the crowded city in a quiet and lovely neighborhood. The hotel is rated 4 stars and it feels like 5!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Fifer7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at San Anselmo to celebrate our Ruby wedding anniversary. The reason I say that first off is if we didn't find the hill to the hotel overly daunting then I am sure most able bodied folk won't either, so I hope it doesn't put people off. We stayed 6 days and got home yesterday. I wanted to post right away to say we found all the positive comments from previous reviewers to be completely accurate. An individual styled, quiet hotel, with a comfortable genteel feel about it; and yet also modern and bright ambience. Breakfasts are substantial, fresh and delicious. The staff was consistently helpful, pleasant, and efficient. I really can't see here where the aloof description from some reviewers is accurate; perhaps a cultural expectation or a language difference? I can only say we didnt find them anything other than as said above. The restaurants in Testaccio are local, excellent and reasonably priced. They are not tourist restaurants, we found them to be full of locals, but you are welcomed (we dont speak any Italian) and if you like experiencing what a place is really like give it a try. The hotel is about 20 minutes walk from the Colliseum and 15 minutes or so from Trastevere. The area is quiet, and beautiful and a nice walk over the hill gets you to Circus Maximus. We had the welcome sparkly wine, the chocs every night, towels are changed twice daily. Really, we can do nothing other than recommend this hotel. We took taxis a couple of times from hotel, all had meter on and were never ripped off as some have found. An example, it cost us 10 euros 20 cents to St Peter Basilica but it depends on traffic I suppose. Great city, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but not ideal for first time visits”
Reviews.Author: Izabel_blue
Reviews.Content: I was really really excited about the Hotel San Anselmo when we booked it after seeing all of the rave reviews here, and I do understand why people love it so much. It's a beautiful space with friendly staff and a really laid-back though classy atmosphere and a nice breakfast. That being said, it was our first time in Rome and I thought that for first-time visitors this hotel was a bit too out of the way. It's a 10-15 minute walk to the closest metro station (Circo Massimo) and if you want to walk any place significant from the hotel door, it's at least 20-30 minutes. I should also add that the Hotel San Anselmo is at the top of a rather large hill as well- it was always a bit of a trial getting home after a packed day out. Also, the hotel is in a very quiet residential neighbourhood - which is good for the tranquillity factor, but makes finding a decent place to eat nearby a bit of a trial, especially as the hotel has no restaurant of it's own. Definitely ask for the restaurant map from front desk! (my tip would be to blunder down to L'Insalata Ricca, for a decent cheap and cheerful roman meal - see http://www.linsalataricca.it/) We had room #834 which was one of the superior rooms, which we specifically booked with a balcony, hoping that we could use it to sit outside - unfortunately we had a balcony but there were no chairs or tables out there - only a tiny bit of standing space and a high hedge keeping us from looking over the neighbourhood. Oh well. In it's favour room #834 has an amazing roll-top bath to luxuriate in, which I took advantage of after all of that walking!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning!!!”
Reviews.Author: lispab
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning hotel. We stayed there for 4 days as part of our honeymoon. It was great. Here's why we liked it: - Free champers and nuts on arrival (we told them it was our honeymoon). Much apreciated after train journey from Sperlonga. - Gorgeous little Baci chocolates on our pillows every night. They are the nicest chocs ever! Stocked up on them at the duty free on way home. - Stunning room, really romantic decor, cool bathroom, lovely balcony. Think we were upgraded as it was our honeymoon, not all rooms had them. - Beautiful breakfasts that can be delivered to your room on request. - Nice little garden. - Quiet residental - helpful, professional staff. The only potential negative is that it is a little bit out of the way, so if you have walking difficulties, I wouldn´t recommend it. We love walking so it didn´t bother us. Also, its not bang in the centre of town, however, the positive of this is that there are some nice and very reasonably priced restaurants nearby. You ccan really get ripped off in the centre. Take an up to date rough guide for restaurant recommendations. Overall, fantastic hotel, great value, but no good if you are not a walker.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Connie072
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights last week and had a very pleasant stay. It is situated in a peaceful tree-lined square on the Aventine Hill away from the traffic noise and bustle and is an oasis of calm to relax in after a day's sightseeing. The staff were friendly and welcoming especially when we arrived at 8am direct from the port. They stowed our luggage away and gave us a tray of coffee, while we looked at the maps they gave us. The receptionist was very helpful and recommended sights nearby to visit - the Colosseum is within walking distance, so is the Ancient City. The breakfasts were very good and included lots of fresh fruit. You could eat in the dining room or outside in the garden. In the evening you could go to the restaurant in the sister hotel around the corner. The staff there were welcoming and friendly too and the food very good. The room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean and the bathroom luxurious with a power shower and jacuzzi. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome who wants a quiet comfortable hotel in a fairly central area.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find but WOW”
Reviews.Author: newlyweds0808
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights during our Italian Honeymoon! We didn't get off to a great start - like a previous writer the taxi from the train station tried to rip us off, by switching our 50 note for a 10 and claiming we had not paid enough! Be careful - you have been warned! When leaving we booked a taxi to the airport with the hotel for 40 euros. The hotel is extravagantly decorated, the staff are helpful (they appear aloof but were happy to assist) and the breakfasts offer a vast choice of fruit, pastries, cheeses, meats, breads, salmon and cereals all can be eaten outside in the garden. The room was cleaned, sometimes twice a day and the jacuzzi bath was bliss after a tiring day of walking. Mini bar, TV and internet in room. Our room had a balcony too. Air con was a bit temperamental, so the room was a bit too cold at night. The hotel can be quite tricky to find when on foot and unfortunately there is no restaurant in the hotel itself. Its located well for sight-seeing, the Colloseum is about a 10 minute walk away. If you head in the direction of Travestere you will come across a delightful food shop, on the main road, called Volpetti - this is the best place ever and they give you lots of tasters! Very good for high quality presents too. Throughly enjoyed and would recommend for a romantic stay or for sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: BooDiddly
Reviews.Content: We used Trip Advisor to help our decision, as I really wanted to stay in a romantic hotel that had the instant Italian feel; this hotel delivered in spades! We have no complaints at all, the room we stayed in (811) The Renaissance Room had a lovely view over the back garden, a most comfortable bed and a welcome Jacuzzi bath after the rigours of walking around the city, I would recommend this to friends and family no problem!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Sant Anselmo”
Reviews.Author: KateALondon
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. We stayed for a short break in July and couldn’t have been more overjoyed with our choice. When I booked, I pre-ordered a cab to collect us from the airport. Our driver, although he didn’t speak English was charming and we managed to communicate in broken French. He took us directly to the hotel for a fixed rate of 50 euros. Even though we were about 4 hours early for check in our room was ready. I had requested at the time of booking a romantic room preferably with a balcony. Even though this was an upgrade on arrival they gave us a beautiful, charming room 818, small but perfectly formed with balcony. The bathroom had a Jacuzzi bath which was wonderful after a long day sightseeing. The hotel is certainly walk-able to all of the sights but far enough away from the madding crowds to enable us to relax. The staff were fantastic, from restaurant recommendations and bookings to the best walking routes to the heart of ancient Rome. Francois the barman was exceptional, professional and friendly, and nothing was too much trouble. I have recommended this hotel to everyone, and hope that my friends and family enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing break”
Reviews.Author: jellyhopper
Reviews.Content: An absolutely wonderfull hotel. The huge breakfast buffet of a morning is gorgeous and to sit under the orange trees in the crisp morning sunshine is amazing. The room was lavishly furnished and kept regularly cleaned by the lovely maids. The one thing that ruins the hotel slightly is the rather aloof / snobby receptionist that works there, though he was only there some evenings, it was dissapointing to be met with such an uncaring attitude. However the rest of the hotel is wonderfull and i would definately reccomend it to everyone out there. Perfect for both a relaxing trip and to see all the sights. The hotel will also give you a map at the start with all the local restaraunts on. This however is rather misleading as there are a number of authentic roman restaraunts in the vicinity that do absolutely gorgeous food which are not listed on the map.

Reviews.Title: “Loved San Anselmo!”
Reviews.Author: buttercup78
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here i was very excited about our stay in Rome. I was not dissapointed. The overall setting of the hotel is very tranquil. When we arrived our room wasnt ready but the staff were very friendly and helpful, we had a drink in the bar and our cases were taken up to our room and we soon followed. we stayed in 824 which was beautiful. there is a jacuzzi shower and bath which is heaven after a long days walking sightseeing! be prepared for a lot of walking or to get taxis into the main areas. we did not venture onto the public transport and basically walked everywhere with the exeption of a taxi to the vatican which cost roughly 12 euro. restaurant wise we walked to trastevere on our first night, second night along the river tiber and our 3rd piazza navona - all reasonably priced and very good food. there is an abundance of restaurants and the hotel did give us a list of nearby places but we chose to go further a field. breakfast here was very good, a selection of cold meats, smoked salmon, eggs and cheese. lots of cereals, pastries and fruit and the staff are on hand with coffee, to sit in the tranquil garden under the orange tree was a beautiful experience in itself! overall a truly wonderful experience and i would not hesitate to return and hope to do so some day. i recommend this hotel to everyone with the exception of those with walking difficulties but then there is always the taxi. go enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: trainergirlK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of our 2 week honeymoon. When we arrived we were put in the Romeo and Juliet suite which did have a small balcony but felt very small and we were disappointed. We asked to be moved and after a bit of faffing we were moved to the Manhattan suite. This was big with a great bathroom that had views across the Aventine hill area, a jacuzzi bath and great shower. The best bit about this room was the balcony which had a table, chairs and outdoor light so we could sit out there all day. The decor of this room was dark reds with some lovely gold sunburst mirrors and murals. There is a supermarket towards the Massimo area and I recommend popping there for olives and drinks to stash in the mini bar as the mini bar prices were quite steep. Breakfast was fantastic ranging from toast and cereal to smoked salmon and pastries. The weather was good enough to sit outside and we didn't feel rushed. Staff were pleasant and helpful. There isn't a lot in the way of nightlife nearby - you need to walk to Trastevere which is a great area but there is a pretty rose garden and a park with a panoramic view of Rome within a short stroll away.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, wonderful San Anselmo”
Reviews.Author: mmminla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at charming Hotel San Anselmo for 3 days in late May 2008 - we had the wonderful luck to have been upgraded to this hotel after booking with its sister property down the street, Hotel Aventino. I tend to like to stay in quieter areas of the cities I visit, away from the noise and chaos, and this hotel completely fit the bill. The neighborhood is at the top of one of Rome's seven hills and the neighborhood is quiet and lovely. Beautiful, old villas and narrow winding streets. Hearing the birds chirping every morning and no traffic noise was a welcome relief to city life. To me, the short walk down the hill for public transportation was worth it. The hotel has a very elegant yet hip vibe about it - the design team took great care in adding special touches that kept the Italian feel yet made it feel modern. The rooms are decorated individually, but all wonderful. We stayed in Room 201 - I can't remember the name, but it was beautiful... gilded touches, chandelier, big bathroom with lots of counter space and completely modern. Most important to us, the bed was very comfortable. The staff, while a bit formal, was very helpful in making museum reservations, restaurant recommendations and calling taxis. BTW, a great restaurant just a 5 min. walk down the hill from the hotel is Perini - delicious, traditional Roman cuisine - a to-die-for spaghetti carbonara, grilled lamb, etc. It's filled with locals, which made it even better. The daily breakfast spread was delicious and extensive - traditional Italian meats and cheeses, but also delicious fresh fruit selections, tomato and mozzarella salad, yogurts, eggs, juices, etc. And of course, any cup of coffee in Italy is fantastic. This was our first trip to Italy, with Rome being our first stop, and Hotel San Anselmo was a wonderful introduction to Italy, and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KOHG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel San Anselmo at the end of May 2008 to get married in Rome, so it will always have great sentimental value for me. The night before the wedding the groom and I stayed in separate rooms - I had room 825 and he had room 834. We both absolutely loved our rooms - 834 is quite small but has a huge bathroom which is the same size as the bedroom! 825 is incredibly romantic with Italian love poems on the walls and a lovely terrace. It doesn't have a bath but it does have a power shower with all kinds of jets on it. On the day of the wedding we were moved into room 829 which was meant to be the best room in the hotel. It was nice but we both actually preferred the rooms that we had been in. 829 was big but only had small windows in the bedroom itself so it felt quite dark. There was also only really limited storage space - no drawers, just one small wardrobe - so we ended up living out of suitcases during our stay. Room 829 does have a terrace, which is a nice feature, but the terrace is shared with the room next door and so is not private, plus the view is away from the centre of Rome rather than towards it so there are no famous landmarks to spot on the horizon. Also the layout of the room is such that when you enter the room you are in a corridor with the entrance to the terrace at the end and then the bedroom is a separate room off to the right. The floor to ceiling windows leading on to the terrace made the corridor very light but also made it like a sauna and the air conditioning unit in the bedroom struggled to keep the room cool unless the door to the bedroom was kept shut all the time. The bathroom was also quite disappointing as it was tiny and had no windows or air conditioning so it became hot quite quickly. We much preferred the bathrooms in the other two rooms. Having said all that, we still loved our stay at Hotel San Anselmo. We had 15 wedding guests staying with us in the hotel and they all loved their rooms. Also things such as breakfast, the garden, the lounge area etc were excellent as stated in the other reviews. Also I must say a final word about the service in the hotel. All the staff were amazingly friendly and efficient. Nothing was too much trouble for them. When we left the hotel to go to the train station it was raining and there were no taxis available at all. The concierge pulled out all the stops for us and called in a favour from an airport transfer service who rushed us to the station free of charge just in time for the train! Without the help of the hotel we would never have made it. I would definitely recommend the hotel but I would specifically request a room that is not 829 next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gasman401
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel for a great price! I have no reason to ever look for another hotel when I return to Rome (I have to return, I threw money in the Trevi fountain and it worked last time). The neighborhood is quiet and beautiful.The rooms are unbelievable, we were upgraded upon arrival. The only recommendation I have is map out exactly where it is if you are trying to find it on your own from the metropolitana.

Reviews.Title: “An experience to be enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: bluebudgieStockport
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the top of one of the low hills of the former ancient Rome, no public transport to the front door. It is 15 minutes or so uphill walk from the Metro at Circo Maximo, 20 more steeply from the Pyramid side. The Vatican is 50 minutes or so by underground (1 euro) so everywhere is handy. If you are of mature years like me and the hill has to be faced it can be offputting. Taxi fares up and down would be prohibitive. The Hotel is a former stylish villa surrounded by others and church buildings. The area is verdant, attractive and peaceful.The gulls, ravens and swallows abound and wake you up.The staff are immaculately correct and polite.Breakfast whilst excellent makes no concessions to Anglo Saxons or Americans My guess is that the Hotel was refurbished four or five years ago by a brilliant designer who had more than a touch of eccentricity a la Salvador Dali about him and whose work is pleasant and occasionally pleasantly bizarre. The "distressing" to our "antique" bedside table was just gaining credibility so some items are ready for a refurb.Access to the bathtub would be awkward for the disabled in our room. The patio and graden are not that big, right up to the party fence but well shielded with greenery. The local restaurants are very ethnic and not at all international. It is possible even to be left with bottles of Grappo and others as "freebees: It is, in short, an experience not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisy280
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was amazing!!! Relaxing, Romantic, Beautiful, Great service!!! Wonderful breakfast in a beautiful setting. Some mornings we ate outside under orange trees. Rome is a fun busy crazy, gritty city, coming back to our hotel before dinner or at the end of a long day was a treat!! We left our windows open and listened to birds singing and children laughing.Some evenings we took a Taxi back and the Taxi drivers would tell us this was the nicest part of Rome!! It is only a 15 minute walk to the colosseum which is nothing in Rome. Our Room was amazing! A huge Canopy bed and Marble bathroom with every modern amenity. I can't wait to stay here again!! Please please try this hotel, you will not be disappointed!! I read 100 travel reviews and planned this trip for 6 months and this hotel was even better than I expected, and I am kind of picky!!. Good Lucky and Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Amazing Rome Experience”
Reviews.Author: squirreljr
Reviews.Content: We had a simply amazing stay at the Hotel S'Anselmo. We stayed in 'Mille Baci', an incredibly romantic room with a canopy bed, an enormous, well-appointed bathroom, and a view of the square. The staff were extremely polite and went out of their way to help us when needed. The lobby area and patios were a welcome respite from the bustle of Rome and breakfast was among the best we had in Europe. This hotel was extremely romantic and a great escape for my wife and I after a meeting in Brussels. A note on the neighborhood. The Aventine hill is a quiet, residential neighborhood in Rome with nice parks and astounding views. Although it is technically in the city center ist is certainly not in the middle of the action. There are no places to eat directly by the hotel. For restaurants it is a 15 minute walk to Trastevere, Testaccio or the Jewish Ghetto. The main tourist sites are a little farther. Indeed, the walk back is UP THE HILL but what do you expect, it's a hill! Personally I loved the location. Rome can get pretty crazy and it is nice to stay a little away from the "scene". If all you care about are the tourist sites then this might not be the place. If you want a romantic getaway in a traditional neighborhood that is still close to everything, this is the place. Overall, I can't say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: 1970Catalunya
Reviews.Content: If you look for a sensational hotel this is the one. Well situated in a very quite area. Room 833 is fantastic and the staff is so nice. You will be as home belive me. Note. Mr. Vincenzo (Reception desk) is so nice. A great professional.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay,lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: keentoexplore
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at this hotel. It was a fantastic stay. We booked two rooms as travelling with friends and all celebrating 40th birthdays. We were delighted with the rooms on arrival.A sumptious 4 poster bed with drapes and twinkling lights in the bathroom. A huge roll top bath and seperate shower/toilet room. Our friends had a lighter room with a balcony with seating and it looked splendid. The staff were attentive and helpful, nothing was too much bother. We had complimentary champagne and chocolates on arrival as celebrating birthdays and flowers as it was "ladies day". We are planning to go back and although we enjoy trying various hotels we are rebooking the San Anselmo, who would want to try any where else when this one was just perfect! It is quite a walk into town but for those who enjoy walking we found it no problem about 15 minutes to Trevi Fountain about 30 minutes to Colesseum.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel ruined by terribly rude service”
Reviews.Author: amonole
Reviews.Content: The beauty of this hotel was not enough to make up for the terribly rude service we got at check in... which continued throughout our 4 night stay. The men behind the desk couldn't be bothered to look up when we needed to ask them something, and offered very little information. They were snotty and totally unhelpful. Furthermore, the hotel is rather far out from the sights. It's a 15-20 minute walk to the Metro, then you have to ride the Metro to other sights. The worst part is on the way back most of the walk is UP THE HILL that the hotel is on. After walking for 8 hours a day we were beat and did not have the energy for it. There were no restaurants in the vicinity as it was more of a residential area, so we were left with no other options but the hotel restaurant. The food there was actually very good, but on our last night in Rome the hotel restaurant was shut down unexpectedly because of "technical problems" and we were so beat we just went back to our room and ate pringles in bed. What a let-down for the last night of our 3 week romantic vacation. I really regret booking this hotel and paying $225 a night for such a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Hki_00120
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Anselmo for three nights and loved it. Sure, the hotel is not in the heart of the city, but the atmosphere, beautifully decorated (standard) room, lobby area, as well as the breakfast room made our visit a very pleasant experience indeed. Not to mention the friendly staff who booked us tables in the city's restaurants and gave good tips and advice. Grazie mille!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, perfect place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: joanne100278
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at The San Anselmo for 2nights in February for my 30th Birthday. We had paid extra for a Superior Room which the hotel had told us would be larger and more luxurious than the Standard rooms (which were still nice). We were not disappointed, it was definitely the nicest we have stayed in. Our room was 834 and had a balcony which looked over the Piazza. We had a huge 4 poster bed and a beautiful bathroom with roll top bath (see my pics). The staff were more than helpful in fact they even arranged for us to use the computer and printer at their sister hotel (San Anselmo did not have a printer!) so that we could check in online for our homebound flight which saved loads of hassle at the airport. Breakfast was lovely as long as you don't expect a cooked English Breakfast but why would you want one in Rome!!!!! As said in other reviews the hotel is in a quiet residential area and is a good walk from all the major sites and attractions but not so far that you'd need to take a taxi (except in your heels in the evening!). The colluseum and Roman Forum are only a 15 minute walk away and the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps an extra 10-15 minutes. We did take a taxi to the Vatican which is much further (probably a 90 minute walk). If you do visit the vatican i would highly recommend prebooking a guided tour before you go. We booked ours through my www.myvaticantours.com and paid about £25 each for a 3 hour tour which also meant we could bypass the long queues. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of going and hope that one day i will return.

Reviews.Title: “Anil n Anju at the S Anselmo in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Anil_n_Anju
Reviews.Content: The hotel came as a recommendation, and we have to say we weren't disappointed. We've come to expect high standards in a 4 star hotel and our expectations were met in every way. The room was great, the staff, service and breakfasts were all spot on. The hotel was about 10 minutes walking distance from the Piramidie Metro station and if you can manage a 15 minute walk, the Circo Massimo Metro station was another option. Lots of food outlets dotted around, very reasonably priced. We will not only definately be going back to Rome, this hotel will be on the shortlist to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster”
Reviews.Author: jjaxon06
Reviews.Content: This was a toatal disaster. I wouldln't recommend this hotel to anyone. At first glance it is a pretty hotel in a quiet residential neighborhood. The room was decorated beautifully, bu tthat is where the good ended for us. The walls were paper thin and we could everything going on around us. Our rooms lights would only stay on for 2 or 3 minutes at a time and then we would have to reset them. It was truly frustrating. They finally decided to move us until the morning when they could do something about the lights. They didn't put us in a nicer room, but a room the was way smaller, had a broken toilet seat, and a bed that was as hard as a rock. We didn't sleep at all that night and moved hotels the next morning. It was a terrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, quirky and individual”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsNoKids
Reviews.Content: My husband decided to treat me to a short break in Rome for my birthday. As we had managed to find excellent air fares we wanted to stay somewhere a little special. We are not fans of large hotels, which can sometime seems a little impersonal, so we chose the San Anselmo because it looked a little different, and well, "Italian" - We were not disappointed, excellent staff, all at pains to be helpful, but discrete. We were given the Romeo & Juliet Room - which has a balcony, - the decor was gold and sumptous, with a very large bed. The rooms aren't overly large, but due to the high ceilings and opulent furnishings they feel utterly self indulgent. Although the hotel doesn't have a restaurant you can use the nearby Hotel San Pio, however the food was unexciting, and the atmosphere a little lacking, principally because it appeared to be full of people on business. In the evening we relaxed in the day room/lounge and treated ourselves to cocktails, all terribly civilised and a million miles away from reality. The hotel is situated in a quiet piazza in nice residential area, and although a little out of the centre, it was a nice retreat. Catch the 23 metrobus from Via Mamorata if travelling to St Peters, just near the excellent delicatessen "Volpetti" - The nearby Parco Savello & walk down to the Bocca Del la Verite (Mouth of Truth) is also to be recommended, all in all a true escape.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful”
Reviews.Author: PrincessEm73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Anselmo for 5 nights over Christmas 2007. It was amazing. Our suite was perfect - jacuzzi bath, big bed. The breakfasts were lovely - enough to get you though until dinner! The hotel is only 15 or so minutes walk from the centre of Rome - there is a metro near by if you don't want to walk so far. We had a great time and really loved the hotel. Em and Panos

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: AirplanedriverNorway
Reviews.Content: My wife and I Just got back from our Christmas trip to Rome. We stayed 6 nights at the Sant Anselmo hotel. I booked this hotel through venere.com and got a good rate.I am an airline pilot and stay at standard chain hotels all the time(Hilton etc). I wanted something totally different, somewhere charming and more personal to stay on my own time and money. The hotel Sant Anselmo exceeded my expectations, I cant really find anything to gripe about. We had only one problem, and that was that we were first given a room on the ground floor (room 802)and there was a terrace door out to the garden that couldnt be left open through the night, there was no window and I have to have the window open at night for fresh air, also I am a light sleeper and the phone in the reception area woke me up several times during the first night. the next morning I explained my problem to the staff at the front desk and they said they are pretty full but would look into it. Returning to the hotel in the afternoon we were offered a choice of 2 rooms that were available, we chose room 814 which is a lovely romantic room, quite large compared to the other rooms, with a large bathroom with jacuzzi bathtub and great shower, there are also 2 sinks and marble everywhere. Towels were changed in the evening and chocolates placed on the pillows. No problems after the move, slept like a baby. The hotel building and grounds are beautiful, it is situated in a residential area surrounded by upscale homes and beautiful churches. I loved sitting outside the main door in the morning listening to the birds singing, the whole area is just breathtakingly beautiful and peaceful. The hotel has a great continental breakfast and a cozy lounge and bar. Feels more like you are staying at someones house rather than a hotel. Even though the hotel was full there was no crowding, you felt like you were just a handfull of people staying there. The service was excellent, you had a request they sorted it out for you. The airline lost our bags, I travel all the time and used to loosing my bags, you usually get them on the next flight. But not Alitalia, the bags arrived at the airport the same night we did but it took them for ever to get them from the airport to the hotel. every time I called they would say please hold and then hang up, I was about to blow my top and head out to the airport and get them myself after 2 days.But the desk manager at the hotel called for us and the same day the bags were brought to our room. Dont know what he said but it worked, great service. Actually all the front desk staff were great, also the waiters. Well I could go on for ever, but if you want something different and high quality this is the hotel for you in Rome. We will definatly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Spumante
Reviews.Content: Hotel was amazing! A quite far from the city centre but we didn´t mind. (Taxi costs 5-7euros from the city). Our room was wery small but well decorated and tidy. Jacuzzi was definitely lovely place to sit and relax after hours of walking! Breakfast was excellent, fruits, cereals, cheeses everything we like to eat in the morning. Staff was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan_Loui
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay at Hotel San’t Anselmo after reading all the positive comments on Tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed as the hotel was wonderful. We stayed at the hotel from the 9th until the 15th of December and managed to get a great room rate from Venere.com. The room was gorgeous and the velvety curtains and Victorian décor provided a charming atmosphere. We also had a Jacuzzi bath that was perfect for relaxing after long days walking around Rome. The hotel staff welcomed us with a big smile and talked good English. They willingly provided us with good tips and information about how to get to the main attractions in Rome. Baci chocolates were left on our pillows every evening, and it became a treat that we really looked forward to. Breakfast provided a good selection of cured meats and Italian cheeses, bread, boiled eggs, cereals, fresh fruit, dried fruit, yoghurt, sweets and pastries. Together with a lovely cappuccino, it was a great way to start off your day in Rome! The Hotel is situated in the quiet area of Aventino, right between the Metro stations of Pyramide and Circo Massimo (both are approximately a 10 minute walk away). It is possible to walk to the main attractions from the hotel, as the Collosseum, Circo Massimo and Foro Rormano are just 15 minutes away, while the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and Piazza Navona are less than a 75 minute walk away, especially if you walk along the Tiber river. The metro is relatively cheap and easy to use. There are two main metro lines, A (red) and B (blue) and both connect at Termini station. Line B runs until 23.00 while Line A runs until 21.00 with night buses taking the same route until 23.00. A single metro ticket (BIT) costs 1 Euro while a day metro ticket (BIG) costs 4 Euro. If you are arriving from Fiumicino Airport you can ask the Hotel to book you a taxi at a fixed rate of 40 Euro for the 25 minute drive. Otherwise you can choose either of the following options to get to the Hotel from Fiumicino: - Get on the stopping train (FR1) from Fiumicino airport and get off at Ostiense, which is connected with Pyramide station (ticket costs 5.75 Euro). You can then walk it to the hotel or else get a taxi for about 8 Euro. OR Getting on the Leonardo Express train from Fiumicino to Termini station (ticket costs 9.50 Euro), and then getting the metro to Circo Massimo or Pyramide. You can then walk it to the hotel or take a taxi for about 8 Euro. I would suggest that you go to Piazza Cavallieri di Malta and look through the keyhole of the front gate. It is just a corner away from the Hotel and through the keyhole you would be able to see the Dome of St Peter’s Basilica! We truly enjoyed our experience at the Hotel San’t Anselmo and would recommend it to anyone who would love a wonderful holiday break in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but had some problems”
Reviews.Author: sparticus2277
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was pleasant. The hotel is beautiful and has an awesome breakfast. We were able to walk to nearly all of the major attractions. We had a little trouble finding the hotel from the subway station, so if you're walking I would suggest printing out step by step directions before you arrive. That said, we were very disappointed when we arrived and were shown to a room on the main level which was not the specific room we had requested. The room was small with only a shower with no shower curtain. Prior to our arrival we had received an e-mail confirmation from the hotel that we would get room 823, "ANGELICA" for the price that was quoted online. We specifically requested this room because we wanted to have a bathtub in the room. When we informed the front desk of the error, he told us that we would not have been given the room for the rate we paid because it was a superior room. We told him that we had an e-mail confirmation to prove it (which we had neglected to print out) but he said it would not make a difference because the room was not available. He said that the best they could do was move us to a nicer room with a view for the following night. The next night when we returned to our new room (the golden room), there was an apology note from management stating that they found the e-mail confirmation but it had not been communicated to the front desk. As a means of compensation they gave us a fruit basket, champagne, and a free dinner at their sister hotel. We appreciated this but were disappointed that the new room did not have a bathtub either. Also, that night, after I had just gotten into bed, an employee of the hotel walked right into the room without knocking. Upon seeing me, he quickly left, but this was non-the-less very unsettling. One other thing to note: the internet that the hotel provides is not free, but we were able to tap into wireless networks in both of the rooms we were in.

Reviews.Title: “Haven in a frenetic city”
Reviews.Author: ScamallNaoi
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because several Tripadvisor reviewers gave very positive feedback which matched what we wanted - i.e. a hotel in a pleasant and quiet location with high standards of accommodation and food. We were not disappointed. The hotel's situation is a little off the beaten track, on a hill about 10-15 minutes walk from what remains of most of ancient Rome's sights, Colosseum, Forum etc. It is a short taxi journey to the Vatican (about 6 euro), or a 90 min. walk along the river. The area - Aventine - is quiet, upmarket, safe. Our room was small but adequate with mini bar, safe, internet, television. All parts of the hotel are lovely, clean. The staff were helpful, pleasant, happy to advise and recommend and make bookings for restaurants, taxis. There is no restaurant but the sister hotel, San Pio, is a 4 minute walk and there is a very pleasant restaurant there. The breakfast room is very nice, indoor and outdoor sections, and plenty of choice - cheeses, fruit, eggs, ham, yogurt, breads and sweet cakes. A haven of peace in this wonderful but frenetic city.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful retreat in the bustle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MerlinB8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel San Anselmo for 3 nights mid September to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We'd looked at a lot of recommended hotels more in the centre of Rome, but decided that we wanted to stay somewhere that was a bit away from the noisy, busy centre. We were a bit disappointed that the taxi we'd arranged through the hotel didn't come to pick us up from the airport, so we just got one from the rank. When we got to the hotel and advised them, the gentleman on reception couldn't have been apologetic, saying that he'd actually booked it himself. The reception itself is stunning, a lot of glass, chandliers & tasteful furniture...............all feeling very cool & calm after the mad Roman drivers, which make you just want to close your eyes & hope for the best! When we got to our room, the previous hassle was soon forgotten! We had a lovely large room on the first floor, a huge shower with green twinkling lights and a veranda with a table & chairs that overlooked the garden. It was a bit noisy in the morning as the kitchen was just below, & we didn't actually use the veranda, but even so it was a stunning room. Also the free San Anselmo hotel cocktail soon soothe our travellers nerves! ;-) Now the breakfast was one of the best things about the hotel!! It was warm enough for us to eat in the garden everyday & there was so much choice - cereals, cheeses, fresh fruit, toast, croissants, meats, cakes etc etc - all very well laid out & fresh. Although this hotel is a bit away from the centre of Rome, we didn't actually find it too far to walk anywhere - especially when we found the short cut to the river down the Aventine hill - mind you a better route going, rather than coming back up the hill! We had intended to use the tourist bus to get around but you got much more of a taste of Rome, by walking through all the hidden side streets & stopping a little coffee bars to rest. Walking back was sometimes more difficult, especially the day when we had a 3 hour liquid lunch in the Hotel de Russie, people watching the immaculate, sophisticated Italians going about their business!! Not sure that wine & expensive boutiques are a good combination either, as we finished with a bit of shopping. ;-) It was so nice to come back to some peace & tranquility after a hard day's sightseeing - just to sit in the chairs outside & have a quick drink & listen to the sound of the birds. We always found the staff very friendly & welcoming. A lovely touch was the little chocolates on the bed when it was turned down - although for some reason we only got those the first day. After all our walking we only managed to to go as far as the sister hotel, Hotel Villa S. Pio, for dinner each night. Well actually the first night we just nipped in for a post sightseeing glass of wine & ended up staying for dinner! Food there was lovely and the service was perfect, outside on the patio, especially the bottle of Veuve Cliquot that my husband had somehow arranged...................and only 5 mins back to the San Anselmo! A couple of things to note - just round from the hotel is a big tall gate in a piazza, which if you look through the keyhole, gives you a perfect view of the dome of St Peter, both day & night. Also a bit further along the road to the right is a small garden with stunning views across Rome to the Vatican. Mind you every which way you look, there is stunning architecture & history! During dinner on our last night we were already planning our return trip.....................need I say more!

Reviews.Title: “Autumn Break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: themacrae
Reviews.Content: got a rate of 270euro b+b via venere.com for this very pleasant hotel in a peaceful part of town and convenient for bus 30 Express and metro (Pyramid) into the centre if you are ready for 10/15 minute walk - downhill going and uphill back. One morning there was a taxi strike which created enormous traffic jams but otherwise the journey in was quick and the bus came often. The hotel room was a triumph of the over egged school of interior design with hanging curtains and a wonderful chandelier. The bathroom was a mass of marble and rococo frames around the mirrors but no where to hang the robes provided. The assumption seems to be that you will throw everything on the floor. Room was decorated with handwritted extracts in italian a form of tasteful graffiti from the poets - Keats, Goethe etc. Tele was new and integrated with internet connection but irritating to operate - did not try the internet connection. MIni bar and safe provided. Room was clean and well-serviced with English speaking maid who remembered our request for extra pillows. Turn down service and Baci on pillow. We had only brought hand luggage with the current restrictions on liquids, aerosols etc so were glad of the shampoos and shower gels - there was one packet of shaving cream which was not replenished. Very pleasant breakfast crew speaking English and good choice of fruit, pastries, boiled eggs, ham and cheese. Ate in the garden on the first morning but it got too cold thereafter but it would be a great asset in summer. The chairs in the inside breakfast room were the heaviest pieces of furniture I have ever attempted to move - they had heavy steel frames. Tried associated restaurant in one of the other two hotels in the big garden square - at 85euros the most expensive meal we two had in Rome and by no means the best but OK for the first evening when we had not had time to explore. Plenty of good restaurants down the hill in Testaccio in the via Luca della Robbia if you want to eat locally. Front desk gave us a useful map of local restaurants which we supplemented with Time Out and Lonely Planet guides. To sum up the hotel met our needs for a comfortable base back in a quiet part of town after hard days' sightseeing. In addition to the location, the premises were stylish if a little over the top and we would go back to the location and perhaps try one of the other properties in the same garden. On last morning, hotel booked taxi to airport - 50euros to Ciampino airport and took about 20 minutes at 0645h on a Saturday morning. The taxi on arrival which we took from Termini was 10euros.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: unclepat
Reviews.Content: As soon as we pulled up outside hotel San Anselmo we were impressed. The location in the heart of leafy, elegant Aventino is perfect and provides a peaceful sanctuary away from the bustle of the city. The Baroque style villa which houses the hotel has been tastefully restored and the interior design is imaginative and elegant. Rooms are well sized and bathrooms are fitted with hydrotherapy baths which are fantastic! The staff are very professional and helpful but if I had one minor criticism, it would be that the front desk staff could be a degree or two warmer. I will certainly return to Rome and will certainly be stay ing at the San Anselmo.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, perfect hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Widsith
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four nights in July and would never willingly stay anywhere else in Rome. I stayed in two different rooms. Both were charmingly furnished and individually decorated down to the elaborate paintings on the wall. The garden in the back is wonderful--oranges, lemons, and palm trees. It's a tiny oasis of calm and a wonderful place to relax on a hot summer night with a tall cool drink in your hand. No wonder Roman emperors have chosen to live on the Aventine since the early days of the empire.

Reviews.Title: “Shhh - Hotel San Anselmo is a secret spot”
Reviews.Author: Leasha
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Anselmo is definitely a secret little spot. We spent 3 nights there in May & hands down, probably one of the most beautiful hotels we have ever stayed at. We requested the white room direct through the hotel. This room was called the Milli Baci (translates to a thousand kisses). Yummy Baci chocolates were left each day by room service. The rooms decor was out of this world. Especially the beautiful chandelier over the bed, which I wanted to take home with me. Its quite a large room with a balcony overlooking the local area of Aventino. From memory it was on the 2nd or third floor. We used the stairs most of the time as the lift is quite slow. There were also many areas to chill out for some private time. The outdoor gardens, a small reading area near the front desk & an outdoor lounge area at the entrance of the hotel. The decor in the dining area was also spectacular. We chose this hotel based on the great reviews & especially wanted somewhere a little quieter out of the main area. It was only a short ride in a taxi to town & walking distance to many local restaurants. You feel like you are in another world staying at this hotel. Very private & romantic. Most couples were on their honeymoon. Definitely a no-kid zone.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: sr42
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd visit at the S.Anselmo in less than a year and once again we were not disappointed.. It's really a bit of pot luck with the rooms as requests for a particular room are not longer easily satisfied.We were told a the time of booking that we had to pay more for a particular one or the other. Never than less you won't be disappointed by any of them as deco and sizes varies but the ones above the reception and breakfast area are not really suited for peace and quite . The noise late evening and early morning can be very irritating. The ones on the top floors are probably the best.Tthey benefit of private terrace and magnificent view but are a bit on the small size especially the bathrooms.Defenitely the quieter of them all. They are overall beautifully decorated and do not lack any of the comforts you would expect from an hotel of this standard The breakfast area is gorgeous and the gardens equally so and what is served is of a very good quality with plenty of choices. The location may not suit everyone as the centre of Rome is hardly near by ,although the Coloseum and the roman forum are basically round the corner......and frankly that is the beauty of it . Far enough from the madness of the tourist areas for a truly relaxing time after a day of sighseeing or shopping but at the same time just a short hop( taxi recomended) to the same places if you chose to do so. The service is generally very good and the housekeeping staff should be comended for their professional attitude and willingness to help at any time. Not the same could be said for the late night shift at the front desk as they can be particularly indifferent to the guests .One or two individuals in particular could benefit from further training . Never than less i highly recomend this place and happily go back to at any time!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous bouqtiue hotel!”
Reviews.Author: plusfour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Anselmo for a 3 night break in Rome in August (our first trip to the city!). One word - fabulous! Top class service, incredible decor, great bathrooms, comfy beds, one of the best breakfasts anywhere and a great location (20 minutes walk to The Colosseum). A little out of the centre (if you want to be right in the thick of it, look elsewhere) but if you like to get away from the hustle and bustle of somewhere as busy and touristy (in a good way) as Rome, this is the hotel for you. No question - this will be where I stay when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Home in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: JoeVGermantown
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sant'Anselmo for 6 nights at the end of July/early August when Rome was sizzlingly hot, and we found the hotel a wonderfully cool and calm refuge and a terrific place to launch our walking tours into the heart of the city. The hotel staff was universally helpful and cordial. Breakfast in the cool, shaded garden was excellent. And the room, though small, had a balcony and a posh bathroom. We walked down to the Pyramide or the Colosseo station each day to start our journey to the various attractions in Rome, and we found getting around very easy. (HINT: buy the 6-day pass [for 16 Euro] available at the Metro [subway] station. This pass gives you access to the Metro and to the buses in Rome.) In the evenings, after dinner in the heart of Rome, we took a taxi back for 6 to 7 Euro, well worth it to avoid the climb back up the hill. Each time we returned we were greeted warmly by the staff who went out of their way to help us enjoy our stay. And don't miss the several beautiful churches and park around the corner from the hotel. A sure hit!

Reviews.Title: “I decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimmyTimTimTim
Reviews.Content: I liked this place a lot. I think you will too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: deestore
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the San Anselmo. I found the hotel originally through my friend from Italy about 10 years ago. The second stay was even more lovely than the first. (From my memory of the first stay, I think they remodeled). The room is quite large for European standards - especially the bath, which had a full size tub with Jacuzzi jets - didn't have time to try it with only two nights in Rome. The breakfast is excellent and certainly not the typical Italian breakfast of coffee and sweet rolls. You can eat inside or on the beautiful garden patio. I imagine the sister hotels on the same block are also nice, since their exteriors looked well kept. This is the only hotel on this trip in which the A/C worked like it was supposed to - we had to turn it down to not freeze. I stayed at the Westin Excelsior in Rome once, that goes for about $600/night. (I had points from Westin so it was free.) It has similar decor in the rooms, but the Westin is a bit musty in comparison. I think the hotels are comparable, both are off the beaten path, and the San Anselmo is 1/6th of the price. The neighborhood by San Anselmo is lovely and safe. Did I mention that the beds at the San Anselmo are very comfortable? P.S. Most hotels in Europe use twin beds and the twin beds are placed next to each other to make a Queen size if you are a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oasis”
Reviews.Author: rrc2406
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 relaxing nights & mornings here between forays into the draining energy of Rome. Superb breakfasts in the tranquil garden, with birds singing in the trees. Romantic walk down the Aventine Hill to the Tiber on a walled Roman cobblestone path with no vehicles. Staff were very attentive and helpful. Stayed in a fantastic room next to the main building with a decent-size bedroom upstairs and an equal size fully-tiled "Roman bath" below - including large open shower/tub. Attended Gregorian chant vespers at the St. Anselmo basilica/monastery just around the corner. If you can't be far from wall-to-wall tourists, traffic, noise and heat, stay near the Spanish Steps and good luck. Otherwise . . .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Setting”
Reviews.Author: nl2boats
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully stylish set in a peaceful residential area on Aventine Hill. I stayed in the scripture room which is fabulously decorated complete with Jacuzzi shower room. There have been a few reviews re staff attitudes, I can honestly say that all the staff we came across were very willing, all spoke English with varying degrees of competence and were discreetly welcoming. They were more than welcome to help us along with our Italian! Breakfast (continental) was thoughtfully laid out in which you could sit in the picturesque private gardens. The walk into town can be cut down by walking up to the top of S’Anselmo (a few mins) and cutting through the park straight down to Circo Maximo in which you are in easy walking distance of the Colosseum and Forum (all downhill!) Then park also has some very nice views across the Tiber. Rome itself is a wonderful contrast and well worth a visit. Colleseum is about 11 Euro but is a must see. There are touts outside who will tell you the wait to get in is about a hour and they would get you in on a tour party for around 22 E (we queued for 10 mins) As for the Vatican the queue looked like it was approx 3 hours long at 830 in the morning (cost 13E) and it does not open until 10am. I know most books say get there early however it may be better to try latter in the day! The Metro is fairly cheap at around 1E a trip although it is a bit grimy down there, be prepared for sardines if going to the Vatican early on the Metro. As for San Pietro the queues look quite long however mainly this is a security check and you get to the front fairly quickly, it is free unless you want to view Rome from the top in which you will pay approx 7E for the lift (then walk up another 300 steps to the top). The views from the top are stunning. Suggest if going by train you go to Ostiense instead of the main terninal at Termini (costs about half) although if you have got an early flight back beware of the early morning trains from here, they are packed! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes to stay close to the centre but have a little peace and tranquillity at the end of a hard days touring. My thanks to all the staff for a wonderful roman experience.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Fault It”
Reviews.Author: HazelWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: We only left this morning and needed to write our review immediately! This is an intimate but beautiful hotel. It is set in a quiet part of the city, 10-15 minutes walk from the Colosseum, no taxi required! We can't fathom what a previous reviewer meant by the reception staff being aloof - they couldn't have been more helpful or more diligent. Every member of staff we came across was helpful and attentive. Breakfast on the terrace was so peaceful, a perfect start to a day in chaotic Rome! The hotel was immaculate with such attention to detail. It was spotless and beautifully maintained. We would stay here again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Below average boutique. Claustrophobic rooms, indifferent staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: other1
Reviews.Content: Overall just another mock boutique, with fake-distressed decor and some quirky interior features. Heavy fabrics and miserable staff give the place a claustrophobic feel. Mostly british tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Sshhhhh Don't tell”
Reviews.Author: Corriedog
Reviews.Content: This place is excellent. In fact it is so good I don't want anyone else to know so that it can stay as it is - Five star romantic luxury at three star prices. We stayed here in Mid July, 36 degree heat but it was nice and cool in our room. Our room was fairly small but all you need and it was beautifully decorated in a sort of roman/Versace style with a lovely marble bathroom containing a spa bath and shower with so many nozzles, I'm not sure what they alll did!! I was six months pregnant and so the bath was a nice luxury after a long hot day doing the tourist thing. My feet were killing me. My husband had his 30th birthday whilst we were there and although I did mention this in an email to the hotel about a couple of months beforehand, they did not need reminding. He was treated to Happy Birthday at breakfast time on a saxophone (yes I know that sounds weird but there was a guy playing the saxophone live outside in the courtyard where we ate our delicious buffet breakfast). Later that day the hotel organised for champagne, crisps and chocolates to be delivered to our room which was just such a nice touch. We felt really special. The hotel is a bit of a walk from the main attractions (Nearest is Colleseum - 15 /20 mins) but if I could cope at 36 degrees and six months pregnant - then anyone can.

Reviews.Title: “San Anselmo - A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: MillyEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: The San Anselmo has the real wow factor! The rooms were simply stunning. The bedroom although a little small was very well designed and furnished. We made our way down an old stone spiral staircase to come across the most amazing bathroom which resembled a modern spa. It had a large sunken pool which you could enjoy with the company of little, twinkling ceiling lights! We had a lovely orange tree outside our door and the breakfast which was had in the room was excellent. There's no restaurant in the hotel which is a bit of a shame. But you're close from the colosseum (15 mins walk). One of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed in, a little hidden gem away from the noisy city hussle and bussle. Finally, if you would like to top this off with a fabulous restaurant try Antica Pesa, the food, service and surroundings were just the best I've ever experienced. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Cleo001
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Anselmo is a truly fantastic find in Rome. Set in a fabulously handsome villa in the jasmine scented quiet part of Rome called Aventine. You were woken by birds in the garden but were a 5 minute taxi into central Rome. Great funky design inside, lovely breakfast, really helpful staff, lovely bathroom. Of course very scatty but what more do you expect in Italy! Great great great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Cabobride
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located in a very residential area about a 15-20 walk to any tourist destinations. We selected it for that reason - to be a retreat away from the craziness of the tourist areas - and I'm so glad we did! Everything from the rooms, the staff and the breakfasts were great. Our room had a semi-private terrace which was a beautiful place to sit during sunset and lookout over the terra cotta roof tops of the neighborhood and the surrounding areas. The neighborhood is located on a hill which offers a nice view. The only cons I can think of...there is no restaurant on premises, but there are many a short walk away that are very local, great places (no "tourist menus"). You'll have to take a taxi to get almost anywhere if you don't want to walk at least 15 minutes. If that doesn't bother you you'll love this hotel - we did!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent honey moon hotel”
Reviews.Author: haapari
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel S. Anselmo for two nights and we really liked the place. The hotel is located in nice and peaceful environment near Aventino park. The location is very different from the other hotels we stayed in Rome due to absence of the chaotic traffic. The colosseum and forum romanum are in walking distance (at least for young people - the walking in 30 degrees temperature was relatively hard). Nearest metro station is also in such distance. Taxi to attractions (e.g. Pantheon) costed about 10 euros. We found nearest restaurants and shops about 500 m down the street to south. There are only apartments around the hotel. The room was excellent: large double room with romantic furniture and decoration, bed with curtains, bath tube, massage shower, flat screen and internet in room (6.5 e/day), small balcony with view to peacefull square. The breakfast (served in the garden) was delicious and luxury: good choice of fruit, cheese, rolls, meat, salmon, etc. There were also good-looking cakes and cereals but we didn't try those. We would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially for honey moon. The price is relatively high but compared to the quality, it is appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: rimrem
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a good quiet residential location that is within a quick hop over to the subway, or within 15-20 min walk to the forum/coliseum. We were very pleased with both the service, and the actual hotel. The rooms are typical size in Europe, but had great ambiance, and ours had a wonderful rain shower in the bathroom. Internet access was cheap at 6.5 Euros a day, and the hotel had a good variety of fresh food for the breakfasts (their coffee was the best we had this entire trip). I'm not too sure why people seemed to think the front desk service isn't very good. They did what we needed them to do, and they provided some useful recommendations for food around the area. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Rome made bearable”
Reviews.Author: JDHall7
Reviews.Content: Hotel Anselmo is an oasis from the noise, congestion, and press of people that is central Rome. It takes only a 15 minute walk through the upscale/attractive residential area of Aventine to be at the Piramide METRO station; from there, all of Rome is readily accessable: Vatican, Spanish Steps, etc. Also, my wife and I leisurely walked from Piazza Novona to Hotel Anselmo in about an hour, through interesting parts of Trastevere. Our room at Hotel Anselmo looked down on the gardens of surrounding homes. The room was comfortable, very clean, a bit overdecorated for my taste, and quiet. It was a great pleasure to have breakfast in the garden, and a glass of wine there after a day of museums and walking. The staff provided good recomendations for meals and off-the-beaten-path attractions, such as the Museo Della Civilta Romana (with a scale model of Imperial Rome that fills a very large room) and the museum Galleria Doria Pamphilj. The hotel staff was always courteous and accommodating. For dinner in the immediate Aventine area I highly recommend ristorante Apvleivs; we had two outstanding evenings there. During our month of traveling in Amsterdam, Switzerland, and Rome, we stayed at hotels identified through Tripadvisor. All the hotels were spot on as described in the reviews. Thank you Tripadvisor, and thank you reviewers.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel San Anselmo
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza S Anselmo 2, 00153 Rome, Italy
